analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' la skyabs su mchi'o //
translated: I go for refuge to all the Tathāgatas and Mañjuśrī, the Wisdom Being.

original: yang dag par glur blangs pa'i chos la skyabs su mchi'o //
analyzed: yang dag par glur blangs pa'i chos la skyabs su mchi'o //
translated: I go for refuge to the Dharma of the true songs.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs la skyabs su mchi'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs la skyabs su mchi'o zhes bya'o //
translated: I go for refuge to the assembly of irreversible Bodhisattvas.

original: de nas sems can thams cad la phan par 'dod pa'i bsam pas byams pa dang / sdug bsngal la nye bar dmigs pa'i snying rje dang / de la mngon par dga' ba'i dga' ba dang / dmigs pa med pa'i btang snyoms bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sems can thams cad la phan par 'dod pa'i bsam pas byams pa dang / sdug bsngal la nye bar dmigs pa'i snying rje dang / de la mngon par dga' ba'i dga' ba dang / dmigs pa med pa'i btang snyoms bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, with the intention of desiring to benefit all sentient beings, one should cultivate loving kindness, compassion that takes on suffering, joy that delights in that, and equanimity that is without reference point.

original: de nas sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra mu: zhes bya bas tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor gshegs su gsol te ;
analyzed: de nas sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra mu: zhes bya bas tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor gshegs su gsol te ;
translated: Then, with “Sarva tathāgata vajra muḥ,” request the departure of the mandala of the gaṇas.

original: aom sarba dharm'a: sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sv'a bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: aom sarba dharm'a: sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sv'a bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
translated: With “Oṃ sarva dharma śūnyatā jñāna vajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ,”

original: zhes bya bas dngos po thams cad stong pa nyid spros pa thams cad dang bral ba 'od gsal ba'i ngo bor bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas dngos po thams cad stong pa nyid spros pa thams cad dang bral ba 'od gsal ba'i ngo bor bsgom par bya'o //
translated: meditate on the essence of clear light, free from all elaborations, the emptiness of all things.

original: de'i rjes la ram las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du h'um bsam mo //
analyzed: de'i rjes la ram las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du h'um bsam mo //
translated: After that, think of a sun maṇḍala from raṃ, and on that, a hūṃ.

original: de gyur pa las sna tshogs rdo rje'o //🔽de @243a * //
analyzed: de gyur pa las sna tshogs rdo rje'o // de @243a * //
translated: From that, a vajra cross arises.

original: las 'od zer spros pas ji tsam 'dod pa'i rgya bar mtshams med par gyur pa'i rdo rje'i sa gzhi dang / de las logs su gyur pa'i rdo rje ra ba dang / steng du gyur pa'i rdo rje'i gur rnams mi bzang pa'i ra ba'i 'od dang ldan pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: las 'od zer spros pas ji tsam 'dod pa'i rgya bar mtshams med par gyur pa'i rdo rje'i sa gzhi dang / de las logs su gyur pa'i rdo rje ra ba dang / steng du gyur pa'i rdo rje'i gur rnams mi bzang pa'i ra ba'i 'od dang ldan pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: From that, light rays radiate and become an indestructible vajra ground, fence, and tent, as extensive as the sky, with the brilliance of a thousand suns.

original: de'i steng du hri dmar po yongs su gyur pa las padma dmar po 'dab ma brgyad pa snying po dang ze'u 'brur ldan pa bsams te /
analyzed: de'i steng du hri dmar po yongs su gyur pa las padma dmar po 'dab ma brgyad pa snying po dang ze'u 'brur ldan pa bsams te /
translated: On top of that, imagine an eight-petaled red lotus with a pistil and stamens, completely transformed from a red hrīḥ.

original: de'i steng du ram las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du ram las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya'o //
translated: On top of that, meditate on a sun maṇḍala from raṃ.

original: de'i steng du tha ma'i kha dog dmar po bsam ste /
analyzed: de'i steng du tha ma'i kha dog dmar po bsam ste /
translated: On top of that, imagine a taṃ syllable, red in color.

original: de gyur pa las autpala ral gris mtshan pa kha dog dmar po de dag gi lte ba la tha ma'i yi ge gsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: de gyur pa las autpala ral gris mtshan pa kha dog dmar po de dag gi lte ba la tha ma'i yi ge gsal bar bya'o //
translated: From that, imagine a red utpala marked with a sword, and in the center of that, visualize the syllable taṃ.

original: sa bon de nas 'od zer spros pas phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bkug ste zhugs par bsam mo //
analyzed: sa bon de nas 'od zer spros pas phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bkug ste zhugs par bsam mo //
translated: Light rays emanate from that seed syllable, inviting all tathāgatas of the three times and ten directions, who dissolve into the taṃ.

original: de dag yongs su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das ye shes sems dpa' sku mdog dkar po zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa padma'i steng na nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi gdan la bzhugs pa /
analyzed: de dag yongs su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das ye shes sems dpa' sku mdog dkar po zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa padma'i steng na nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi gdan la bzhugs pa /
translated: From that complete transformation, the Bhagavat Jñānasattva is white, with one face and two hands, standing on a lotus and sun maṇḍala seat.

original: lo bcu drug pa'i cha byad can gser gyi rgyan cha lngas brgyan zhing nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'od dang ldan pa /
analyzed: lo bcu drug pa'i cha byad can gser gyi rgyan cha lngas brgyan zhing nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'od dang ldan pa /
translated: She is sixteen years old, adorned with five golden ornaments, and has the radiance of a million suns.

original: rdo rje skyil mo krung gi tshul gyis /
analyzed: rdo rje skyil mo krung gi tshul gyis /
translated: She is in the posture of vajra posture.

original: phyag g-yas pa ni shes rab kyi ral gri autpala las 'debs pa'i tshul gyi spyi bo'i steng na 'dzin cing /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pa ni shes rab kyi ral gri autpala las 'debs pa'i tshul gyi spyi bo'i steng na 'dzin cing /
translated: Her right hand is in the gesture of bestowing generosity, holding a sword of wisdom and an utpala flower above her head.

original: phyag g-yon pa chos thams cad stong pa nyid du ston pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i po ti 'dzin pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yon pa chos thams cad stong pa nyid du ston pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i po ti 'dzin pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Her left hand holds a volume of the perfection of wisdom, which teaches that all phenomena are emptiness.

original: de nas rang gi snying gar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du tha ma'i yi ge bzhag nas /
analyzed: de nas rang gi snying gar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du tha ma'i yi ge bzhag nas /
translated: Then, in one’s heart, on a sun maṇḍala, one should place the final letter.

original: de las 'od zer spros pas 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' yongs su grub pa nyid mdun gyi nam mkha' la spyan drangs shing zhal bsil la sogs pas mchod nas /
analyzed: de las 'od zer spros pas 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' yongs su grub pa nyid mdun gyi nam mkha' la spyan drangs shing zhal bsil la sogs pas mchod nas /
translated: Light rays emanate from that, inviting the perfect wisdom being Mañjuśrī into the space in front. Having made offerings with washing the face, and so on,

original: dza: h'um bam ho: zhes brjod pas bdag nyid la gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: dza: h'um bam ho: zhes brjod pas bdag nyid la gzhug par bya'o //
translated: one should enter into oneself by reciting jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ.

original: de nyid chu dang 'o ma 'dres pa ltar bsams nas /
analyzed: de nyid chu dang 'o ma 'dres pa ltar bsams nas /
translated: Having contemplated that very [union] like a mixture of water and milk,🔽again light rays emanate from the last [syllable] at the heart.

original: yang snying ga'i tha ma las 'od zer spros pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad spyan drangs nas /
analyzed: yang snying ga'i tha ma las 'od zer spros pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad spyan drangs nas /
translated: Having invited all the tathāgatas,

original: dbang bskur bar gsol ba btab par bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbang bskur bar gsol ba btab par bya ba ni /
translated: one should supplicate them to confer the empowerment.🔽[Recite:] “Oṃ, all tathāgatas, please confer the empowerment of the glorious gnosis.”

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa bhi shinydzu shri ye zhes bya bas rig pa'i lha mo rnams kyis bdud rtsi'i chus dbang bskur bar bsam par bya'o //🔽de nas chos rnams thams cad kyi //
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa bhi shinydzu shri ye zhes bya bas rig pa'i lha mo rnams kyis bdud rtsi'i chus dbang bskur bar bsam par bya'o // de nas chos rnams thams cad kyi //
translated: One should imagine that the awareness goddesses confer the empowerment with the water of the elixir.🔽Then, one should recite this verse:

original: don @243b gcig gnyis med yid ldan zhing //
analyzed: don @243b gcig gnyis med yid ldan zhing //
translated: “Endowed with the single, nondual meaning of all phenomena,

original: tshogs mchog sku gsum sgrub byed pa //
analyzed: tshogs mchog sku gsum sgrub byed pa //
translated: the supreme assembly, accomplishing the three bodies,

original: tshigs su bcad pa rab bstan bya //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa rab bstan bya //
translated: the verse is well proclaimed.”

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dbus gnas par //🔽'khor lo ser po rtsibs brgyad ni //
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dbus gnas par // 'khor lo ser po rtsibs brgyad ni //
translated: In the center of a sun maṇḍala,🔽one should meditate on an eight-spoked yellow wheel

original: gser gyi 'od dang bcas pa bsgom //
analyzed: gser gyi 'od dang bcas pa bsgom //
translated: with the light of gold.

original: lte ba la ni 'jam byed pa'i //
analyzed: lte ba la ni 'jam byed pa'i //
translated: In the center, one should meditate

original: yi ge thig le bcas pa bsgom //
analyzed: yi ge thig le bcas pa bsgom //
translated: on the syllable with a drop.

original: de yi shar phyogs rtsibs la ni //
analyzed: de yi shar phyogs rtsibs la ni //
translated: On the eastern spoke,

original: dngos kun skye ba med pa dgod //
analyzed: dngos kun skye ba med pa dgod //
translated: one should place the nonarising of all things.

original: lho yi phyogs la rdul dang bral //
analyzed: lho yi phyogs la rdul dang bral //
translated: The south is free from dust.

original: nub phyogs don dam kun bskyed de //
analyzed: nub phyogs don dam kun bskyed de //
translated: The west is the ultimate, the producer of all,

analyzed: shar lho shes pa'i lugs can yin //

analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'o //

analyzed: de dag thams cad skye ba med pa'i tshul gyis aa zhes bya ba nyid de /

original: de thugs su chud pa la sangs rgyas yin zhing de bas na /
analyzed: de thugs su chud pa la sangs rgyas yin zhing de bas na /
translated: One who realizes that is a Buddha, and so

analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas aa las 'byung //

original: zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyid do //

analyzed: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / ces bya ba ni de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam pa gnyis ka mchog ces bya ba nyid do //
translated: means that both the conventional and the ultimate are the best.

analyzed: de la kun rdzob la ni brjod pa thams cad la aa gtso bor gyur pas na mchog ces bya ba ste /

analyzed: brda ni brjod pa la rag las pa'i phyir rnam par dbye ba gzhan du med do //

original: don chen yi ge dam pa yin //
analyzed: don chen yi ge dam pa yin //

original: zhes pa ni de'i don sgrub par byed pas ni don chen po yin zhing de nyid yi ge dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de'i don sgrub par byed pas ni don chen po yin zhing de nyid yi ge dam pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de'i yi ge kun la khyab kyang dbyer mi phyed pa'i phyir /

original: khong nas 'byung ba skye ba med //🔽ces bya'o // de nyid brjod pa dang bral bas na /
analyzed: khong nas 'byung ba skye ba med // ces bya'o // de nyid brjod pa dang bral bas na /

analyzed: tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa ste // zhes bya zhing brjod pa thams cad kyi rgyur gyur bas na /

analyzed: brjod pa kun gyi rgyu yi mchog / ces bya'o // de nyid kyis tshig gi tshogs thams cad gsal bar byed pas na /

original: tshig kun rab tu gsal bar byed //
analyzed: tshig kun rab tu gsal bar byed //
translated: It is called the illuminator of all words because it illuminates all collections of words.

original: ces te kun rdzob kyi tshul du bshad do //
analyzed: ces te kun rdzob kyi tshul du bshad do //
translated: This is explained in the manner of the conventional.

original: don dam pa'i tshul du bshad pa ni gnyis su med ba'i ye shes bde ba chen po'i rnam par rtog pa'i tshogs mtha' dag aa yin la /
analyzed: don dam pa'i tshul du bshad pa ni gnyis su med ba'i ye shes bde ba chen po'i rnam par rtog pa'i tshogs mtha' dag aa yin la /
translated: The explanation in the ultimate way is that the great bliss of nondual intuition is the a, since it is the totality of the conceptualized.

original: de nyid bde ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po dang khams dang bcas pa'i skye mched dang thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pas na mchog ces bya'o //

translated: That itself is the supreme of all the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, which are contaminated bliss, and so it is called supreme.

original: de nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i don chen po mi 'gyur ba nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: de nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i don chen po mi 'gyur ba nyid yin pas na /
translated: That itself is the great meaning, which is unchanging, and so🔽it is the supreme of all meanings.

original: don chen yig dam pa yin //
analyzed: don chen yig dam pa yin //
translated: It is the supreme of all meanings, the ultimate letter.

original: zhes bya'o // khong nas 'byung ba skye ba med //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // khong nas 'byung ba skye ba med //
translated: It is the unborn, which arises from within,

analyzed: ces bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched la gnas kyang de las ma skyes pa nyid do //

original: tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa ste //
analyzed: tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa ste //
translated: It is free from verbal expression,

original: zhes pa ni de nyid ngag gis brjod pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de nyid ngag gis brjod pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: means that it is free from verbal expression.

original: brjod pa kun gyi rgyu yi mchog /
analyzed: brjod pa kun gyi rgyu yi mchog /
translated: It is the supreme cause of all expressions.

original: ces pa ni de ltar phung po dang khams dang skye mched thams cad kyi rgyu yin zhing 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo ste mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni de ltar phung po dang khams dang skye mched thams cad kyi rgyu yin zhing 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo ste mchog ces bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is the cause of all the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields, and is the essence of clear light, which is called “supreme. ”

original: de nyid rten la gnas kyi bar du dngos po thams cad gsal bar gyur pas na /
analyzed: de nyid rten la gnas kyi bar du dngos po thams cad gsal bar gyur pas na /
translated: Since it is the basis for the manifestation of all things until the end of time,

original: tshig kun rab tu gsal bar byed //
analyzed: tshig kun rab tu gsal bar byed //
translated: it is the illuminator of all words.

original: ces bya'o // yang chos nyid stong pa nyid 'di ltar snang ba'o rnam @244b pa thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pas na /
analyzed: ces bya'o // yang chos nyid stong pa nyid 'di ltar snang ba'o rnam @244b pa thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pas na /
translated: Moreover, this reality of emptiness appears in all aspects, and so is supreme,

original: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / ces bya'o //
analyzed: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / ces bya'o //
translated: and so is called “the supreme of all syllables. ”

original: don chen dam pa yi ge yin //
analyzed: don chen dam pa yi ge yin //
translated: It is the syllable of the great and holy meaning.

original: zhes bya ba ni de nyid don dam pa'i sgrub pa mi 'gyur ba nyid yin pas na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de nyid don dam pa'i sgrub pa mi 'gyur ba nyid yin pas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Since it is the unchanging accomplishment of the ultimate meaning, it is called that.

original: khong nas 'byung ba skye ba med //
analyzed: khong nas 'byung ba skye ba med //
translated: It is the unborn, which arises from within.

original: ces pa ni 'jig rten pa'i dngos po thams cad stong pa nyid kyis khyab kyang dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces pa ni 'jig rten pa'i dngos po thams cad stong pa nyid kyis khyab kyang dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although all worldly things are pervaded by emptiness, they are inseparable.

original: de nyid tshig gi brjod pa las 'das pas na /
analyzed: de nyid tshig gi brjod pa las 'das pas na /
translated: Since it is beyond verbal expression,

original: tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa ste //🔽zhes bya'o // rten dang brten pa thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa dang rtog pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa ste // zhes bya'o // rten dang brten pa thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa dang rtog pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: and is free from verbal expression.

original: brjod pa kun gyi rgyu yi mchog / ces bya'o //
analyzed: brjod pa kun gyi rgyu yi mchog / ces bya'o //
translated: It is the supreme cause of all expression,

original: tshig kun rab tu gsal bar byed //
analyzed: tshig kun rab tu gsal bar byed //
translated: and illuminates all words.

analyzed: ces bya ba dngos po'i rnam par rtog pa rnams chos nyid stong pa nyid mthong bas gsal bar byed pas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The conceptual thoughts of entities are illuminated by seeing the emptiness of reality.

original: de ltar don dam pa thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i don bde ba chen po'i ye shes te /
analyzed: de ltar don dam pa thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i don bde ba chen po'i ye shes te /

analyzed: ltos pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bsgom par bya ba'am zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Is it to be cultivated by the characteristic of non-dependence? No, it is not.

analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i bdag nyid phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ni snod rnam par dag par byas pas skyed pa ste /

original: de bas na dbang gi gnas skabs bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de bas na dbang gi gnas skabs bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the stage of empowerment is taught.

original: mchod pa chen po 'dod chags che ste lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa sprul pa'i sku ni sna tshogs pa'i ming dang ldan zhing 'khor ba ji srid kyi bar du 'gro ba'i don 'byam klas par mdzad cing /

translated: The great offering, great desire, the emanation body, the teacher of gods and humans, has various names and performs the boundless benefit of beings for as long as samsara exists.

analyzed: thugs mnyam pa nyid kyi don thams cad snyoms par mdzad pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the equality of mind is to be impartial to all.

original: ming yang che zhing rgya che ba //
analyzed: ming yang che zhing rgya che ba //
translated: The name is also great and vast.

original: dkyil 'khor chen po yangs pa yin //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po yangs pa yin //
translated: It is the great, vast mandala.

original: zhes bya'o // de ltar sku gsum gyi bdag nyid chen po'i rang bzhin bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de ltar sku gsum gyi bdag nyid chen po'i rang bzhin bstan pa ni /
translated: Thus, the nature of the great identity of the three kayas is taught.🔽The great weapon of wisdom

original: shes rab mtshon chen 'chang ba ste //🔽zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: shes rab mtshon chen 'chang ba ste // zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: is the great weapon of wisdom.

original: de nyid 'jig rten pa'i dpe bzhis bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid 'jig rten pa'i dpe bzhis bstan pa ni /
translated: That is taught by four worldly examples.

original: ral gri chen po dang lcags kyu chen po dang / grags pa chen po dang / snang ba chen po rnams thabs shes rab gnyis su med pa'i dga' ba dang po ni rnam par rtog pa'i tshogs mtha' dag gcod pas na ral gri dang / bde ba gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ngan 'gro'i mtshan nyid las 'dren par byed pas nas lcags kyu dang /
analyzed: ral gri chen po dang lcags kyu chen po dang / grags pa chen po dang / snang ba chen po rnams thabs shes rab gnyis su med pa'i dga' ba dang po ni rnam par rtog pa'i tshogs mtha' dag gcod pas na ral gri dang / bde ba gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ngan 'gro'i mtshan nyid las 'dren par byed pas nas lcags kyu dang /
translated: The great sword, the great hook, the great fame, and the great light are the first joy of nondual method and wisdom. Since it cuts the entire mass of conceptuality, it is the sword. Since it draws one from the characteristics of the lower realms, which are characterized by the second joy, it is the hook.

original: bde ba bzhi'i mtshan nyid 'das pa la nye bar 'dzin pas na grags pa dang / bde ba gsum pa'i mtshan nyid rang rig pa bde ba chen po'i @245a * //
analyzed: bde ba bzhi'i mtshan nyid 'das pa la nye bar 'dzin pas na grags pa dang / bde ba gsum pa'i mtshan nyid rang rig pa bde ba chen po'i @245a * //
translated: Since it holds the characteristics of the fourth joy, it is fame. Since the characteristics of the third joy, which is the luminosity of the great bliss of self-awareness,

original: 'od gsal bar gnas pas /
analyzed: 'od gsal bar gnas pas /
translated: abides,🔽it is the supreme hook of great affliction.

original: nyon mongs chen po lcags kyu'i mchog / grags chen snyan grags chen po ste //
analyzed: nyon mongs chen po lcags kyu'i mchog / grags chen snyan grags chen po ste //
translated: It is great fame and great renown.

original: snang ba chen po gsal ba che //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: snang ba chen po gsal ba che // zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is great light and great clarity.

original: ci dag so so skye bo la sogs pa'i 'dod pa'i bde ba dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: ci dag so so skye bo la sogs pa'i 'dod pa'i bde ba dang mtshungs so //
translated: Are they the same as the mundane bliss of desire of ordinary beings and so on?

original: 'o na khyad par yod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na khyad par yod ce na /
translated: If not, what is the difference?

original: 'di nyid thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa sprul pa lta bus bstan pa ni dga' ba dang po nye bar 'dzin pas /
analyzed: 'di nyid thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa sprul pa lta bus bstan pa ni dga' ba dang po nye bar 'dzin pas /
translated: This is shown by the nondual method and wisdom, like an emanation, which is the first joy.

original: mkhas pa sgyu 'phrul chen po 'chang //
analyzed: mkhas pa sgyu 'phrul chen po 'chang //
translated: The wise one is the great illusionist.

original: zhes pa dang / de bzhin du dga' ba gnyis pa lhan cig skyes pa'i don grub pas na /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / de bzhin du dga' ba gnyis pa lhan cig skyes pa'i don grub pas na /
translated: Similarly, the second joy is the accomplishment of the innate,

original: sgyu 'phrul chen po don grub pa //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul chen po don grub pa //
translated: the great illusionist who accomplishes the goal.

original: zhes pa dang / dga' ba chen po gsum pa dang bde ba chen po spros pa dang bral bas gnas pas /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / dga' ba chen po gsum pa dang bde ba chen po spros pa dang bral bas gnas pas /
translated: The third great joy is the great bliss free from proliferation,

original: sgyu 'phrul chen po dga' bas dga' //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul chen po dga' bas dga' //
translated: the great illusionist who delights in joy.

original: zhes pa dang / dga' ba bzhi pa med pa'i dngos po la nges par 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / dga' ba bzhi pa med pa'i dngos po la nges par 'dzin pa ni /
translated: The fourth joy is the ascertainment of the nonexistent thing,

original: sgyu 'phrul chen po mig 'phrul can //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul chen po mig 'phrul can //
translated: the great illusionist who is an illusion.

original: zhes bya'o // de lta bu'i bde ba chen po gang yin pa de nyid pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dang ldan par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de lta bu'i bde ba chen po gang yin pa de nyid pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dang ldan par bstan pa ni /
translated: That great bliss itself is endowed with the ten perfections.

original: sbyin bdag chen po gtso bo ste //🔽zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sbyin bdag chen po gtso bo ste //🔽zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The great lord is the chief.

original: de la de nyid khams gsum thams cad la sbyin pa rnams kyi mchog bde ba chen po ster bas na /
analyzed: de la de nyid khams gsum thams cad la sbyin pa rnams kyi mchog bde ba chen po ster bas na /
translated: In that, since it bestows great bliss, which is the supreme of all the gifts to the three realms, it is called “the great lord of generosity.”

original: sbyin bdag chen po zhes bya ba dang / rtog pa'i dri ma dang bral ba 'dzin cing nyan thos la sogs pa'i tshul khrims las khyad par du gyur pas na /🔽tshul khrims chen po 'chang ba'i mchog / ces bya la phyi rol gyi rnam par g-yeng bas mi brdzi zhing de nyid bde ba chen por bstan pas na /🔽bzod chen 'chang ba brtan pa po //
analyzed: sbyin bdag chen po zhes bya ba dang / rtog pa'i dri ma dang bral ba 'dzin cing nyan thos la sogs pa'i tshul khrims las khyad par du gyur pas na / tshul khrims chen po 'chang ba'i mchog / ces bya la phyi rol gyi rnam par g-yeng bas mi brdzi zhing de nyid bde ba chen por bstan pas na / bzod chen 'chang ba brtan pa po //
translated: Since it holds and listens to the freedom from the stain of conceptuality, it is superior to the ethics of śrāvakas and so on, and therefore it is called “the supreme holder of great ethics.”

original: zhes bya ste /🔽de ltar bde ba chen po de nyid rtogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bar du bde ba bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ste / de ltar bde ba chen po de nyid rtogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bar du bde ba bsgom pa ni /
translated: Since it is not overwhelmed by external distractions and is taught to be great bliss, it is called “the great patience holder, the steadfast one.”

original: brtson 'grus chen po brtul ba yin //
analyzed: brtson 'grus chen po brtul ba yin //
translated: Thus, the meditation on the bliss of the realization of great bliss up to the suffering is called “the great effort, the one with perseverance.”

original: zhes pa dang de nyid mtshan ma'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas rtse gcig pa dang / bsam gtan chen po ting 'dzin gnas //
analyzed: zhes pa dang de nyid mtshan ma'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas rtse gcig pa dang / bsam gtan chen po ting 'dzin gnas //
translated: Since that is free from the conceptuality of signs, it is the single focus, and since it is free from the distraction of the mind, it is called “the great concentration, the samādhi holder.”

original: zhes pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog yin zhing shes rab de nyid chos thams cad kyi rten du gyur pas na /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog yin zhing shes rab de nyid chos thams cad kyi rten du gyur pas na /
translated: The supreme perfection of wisdom is the very absence of conceptual thought. And since that wisdom is the basis of all dharmas,

original: shes rab chen po lus 'chang ba //
analyzed: shes rab chen po lus 'chang ba //
translated: it is called the great wisdom body.

original: zhes bya'o // de lta bu'i bde ba chen po des bdud kyi tshogs mtha' dag 'joms pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sgrub pa'i thabs chen po dang ldan pas na /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de lta bu'i bde ba chen po des bdud kyi tshogs mtha' dag 'joms pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sgrub pa'i thabs chen po dang ldan pas na /
translated: Since that great bliss conquers the entire host of demons and is endowed with the great means for accomplishing perfect buddhahood,

original: stobs po @245b che la thabs che ba //
analyzed: stobs po @245b che la thabs che ba //
translated: it is called the great strength and great means.🔽Since that very [bliss] is the aspiration for the happiness of all beings,🔽it is called the great aspiration.

original: zhes pa ste de nyid 'gro ba mtha' dag bde bar smon pa dang / de nyid rgyu'i ye shes nges pa chen por gnas pa dang / smon lam ye shes rgya mtsho ste //
analyzed: zhes pa ste de nyid 'gro ba mtha' dag bde bar smon pa dang / de nyid rgyu'i ye shes nges pa chen por gnas pa dang / smon lam ye shes rgya mtsho ste //
translated: Since that very [bliss] abides as the great certainty of the wisdom of the cause,🔽it is called the great wisdom.🔽Since that very [bliss] is the ocean of the wisdom of aspiration,🔽it is called the great ocean.

original: zhes bya ste de dag ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba nas ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ste de dag ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba nas ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: Those are called the perfections of generosity and so on up to the perfection of wisdom.

original: bde ba chen po de nyid sems can thams cad la phan pa'i mtshan nyid du gnas pas na /
analyzed: bde ba chen po de nyid sems can thams cad la phan pa'i mtshan nyid du gnas pas na /
translated: Since that very great bliss abides as the characteristic of benefit for all sentient beings,

original: byams chen rang bzhin dpag tu med //
analyzed: byams chen rang bzhin dpag tu med //
translated: it is the nature of great love, immeasurable.

original: ces pa nas 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal rnams sel bar 'dod cing dag pa chen po'i yid dang ldan pas na /
analyzed: ces pa nas 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal rnams sel bar 'dod cing dag pa chen po'i yid dang ldan pas na /
translated: Since it is the desire to remove the sufferings of migrating beings and possesses the mind of great purity,🔽it is the supreme mind of great compassion.

original: snying rje chen po blo yi mchog / ces bya la de nyid 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad dang bral zhing chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du gnas pas na /🔽shes rab chen po blo chen ldan //
analyzed: snying rje chen po blo yi mchog / ces bya la de nyid 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad dang bral zhing chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du gnas pas na / shes rab chen po blo chen ldan //
translated: Since it is free from the eight worldly dharmas and abides as the equality of all phenomena,

original: zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: it is great wisdom, possessing a great mind.

original: de lta bas na sangs rgyas kyi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pas na phyin ci ma log par rtogs shing thabs rnam pa sna tshogs pas 'gro ba 'dul bar mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: de lta bas na sangs rgyas kyi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pas na phyin ci ma log par rtogs shing thabs rnam pa sna tshogs pas 'gro ba 'dul bar mdzad pa ni /
translated: Therefore, since it possesses the perfect qualities of a buddha, it is the unmistaken realization that tames migrating beings through various methods.

original: mkhas pa chen po thabs che ba //
analyzed: mkhas pa chen po thabs che ba //
translated: It is the great skill, the great method.

original: zhes bya'o // bya ba tshegs chung dus bdag nyid sangs rgyas kyi rdzu 'phrul chen pos khams gsum pa thams cad 'dul bar mdzad pas na /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // bya ba tshegs chung dus bdag nyid sangs rgyas kyi rdzu 'phrul chen pos khams gsum pa thams cad 'dul bar mdzad pas na /
translated: He is the one who, with little difficulty, tames the entire three realms with the great miracles of a buddha.

original: rdzu 'phrul chen po stobs dang ldan //🔽zhes bya la de nyid myur ba nyid du ngan 'gro las thar pa chen por grol bar mdzad pas na /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul chen po stobs dang ldan // zhes bya la de nyid myur ba nyid du ngan 'gro las thar pa chen por grol bar mdzad pas na /
translated: Thus, he is the one who is called the one with great miracles and strength.🔽He is the one who, in a short time, liberates from the lower realms.

original: shugs chen mgyogs pa chen po ste //
analyzed: shugs chen mgyogs pa chen po ste //
translated: Thus, he is the one who is called the one with great speed and great strength.

original: zhes bya zhing sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad na thogs pa med pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'khor dang bcas pas chos ston par mdzad pas na /🔽rdzu 'phrul chen po cher grags pa //
analyzed: zhes bya zhing sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad na thogs pa med pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'khor dang bcas pas chos ston par mdzad pas na / rdzu 'phrul chen po cher grags pa //
translated: He is the one who, in all buddhafields, has unobstructed miracles and teaches the Dharma with an entourage of bodhisattvas.

original: zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: Thus, he is the one who is called the one with great miracles and great fame.

original: de lta bu'i bde ba chen po dri ma med pas nyon mongs pa'i tshogs 'jigs par mdzad pas na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i bde ba chen po dri ma med pas nyon mongs pa'i tshogs 'jigs par mdzad pas na /
translated: He is the one who, with stainless great bliss, terrifies the hosts of afflictions.

original: stobs chen pha rol gnon pa po //
analyzed: stobs chen pha rol gnon pa po //
translated: Thus, he is the one who is called the one with great strength and great prowess.

original: zhes bya'o // rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis yang dang yang du 'byung ba srid pa yin la de nyid ri bo che po ltar gzhom par dka' ba 'joms pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis yang dang yang du 'byung ba srid pa yin la de nyid ri bo che po ltar gzhom par dka' ba 'joms pa la /
translated: Existence is the repeated occurrence by the power of conceptual thought, and that is difficult to overcome like a great mountain.

original: srid pa'i ri bo chen po 'joms //
analyzed: srid pa'i ri bo chen po 'joms //
translated: It overcomes the great mountain of existence.

original: zhes bya'o // 'joms pa de gang yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // 'joms pa de gang yin snyam pa la /
translated: What is that overcoming?

original: mkhregs shing rdo rje chen po 'chang //
analyzed: mkhregs shing rdo rje chen po 'chang //
translated: It is the great vajra holder,

original: zhes gsungs te gnyis su med pa'i ye shes chen po ni rnam par rtog pa'i tshogs kyi dbyer mi phyed cing rig sngags dang / rnam par rtog pa brgyad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa @246a * //
analyzed: zhes gsungs te gnyis su med pa'i ye shes chen po ni rnam par rtog pa'i tshogs kyi dbyer mi phyed cing rig sngags dang / rnam par rtog pa brgyad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa @246a * //
translated: The great nondual wisdom is indivisible from the host of conceptual thoughts, and it is the knowledge mantra and the eight conceptual thoughts and so on, endowed with the immeasurable qualities of the tathāgatas.

original: gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //🔽de la dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa gdul dka' rnams 'jigs byed chen po'i cha lugs kyis 'dul bar mdzad cing khams gsum pa 'joms par mdzad pas na /
analyzed: gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o // de la dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa gdul dka' rnams 'jigs byed chen po'i cha lugs kyis 'dul bar mdzad cing khams gsum pa 'joms par mdzad pas na /
translated: That is what it is called.

original: drag po chen po drag shul che //
analyzed: drag po chen po drag shul che //
translated: It is the great wrathful one, the great ferocity,

original: 'joms byed 'jigs par byed pa po //
analyzed: 'joms byed 'jigs par byed pa po //
translated: The destroyer, the terror of the fearful.

original: zhes bya ba nyid do ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyid do ;
translated: Thus it is.

original: / srid pa'i 'jigs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi mgon mdzad cing rigs kyi bye brag mang po rnams kyi nang na ye shes chen po 'di dam par gyur pas na /🔽mgon po rigs mchog chen po ste //
analyzed: / srid pa'i 'jigs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi mgon mdzad cing rigs kyi bye brag mang po rnams kyi nang na ye shes chen po 'di dam par gyur pas na / mgon po rigs mchog chen po ste //
translated: Since it acts as the protector of those who are subject to the fears of existence, and since this great wisdom is the best among the many different types of spiritual family,🔽it is the protector, the great, sublime spiritual family.

original: bla ma gsang sngags chen po'i mchog / ces bya ba ni 'jam dpal zhes bya ba'i ming nyid nges par bzung ba ste ;
analyzed: bla ma gsang sngags chen po'i mchog / ces bya ba ni 'jam dpal zhes bya ba'i ming nyid nges par bzung ba ste ;
translated: The one called Mañjuśrī is the one who is referred to by the name Mañjuśrī.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bla ma chen po ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes de yin la khams gsum pa thams cad kyi yid skyob par byed pas na /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bla ma chen po ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes de yin la khams gsum pa thams cad kyi yid skyob par byed pas na /
translated: The great teacher of all buddhas of the past, present, and future is the nondual wisdom, and since it protects the minds of all those in the three realms,

original: de nyid spyod pa kun ston pa'i mchog tu gyur pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid spyod pa kun ston pa'i mchog tu gyur pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: it is the supreme one who reveals all activities.

original: theg pa chen po'i tshul la gnas //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i tshul la gnas //
translated: It is the one who abides in the way of the Great Vehicle.

original: theg pa chen po'i tshul gyi mchog / ces bya ba ni gong du bstan pa ltar khams gsum pa'i sems can thams cad rjes su 'dzin pa ni theg pa chen po'i tshul la gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i tshul gyi mchog / ces bya ba ni gong du bstan pa ltar khams gsum pa'i sems can thams cad rjes su 'dzin pa ni theg pa chen po'i tshul la gnas pa yin la /
translated: As taught above, to take care of all sentient beings of the three realms is to abide in the way of the Great Vehicle.

original: de nyid byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That itself is called the vehicle of the bodhisattvas.🔽The supreme of all vehicles is the Great Vehicle.

original: theg pa thams cad kyi rab mchog chen por gyur pa ni /
analyzed: theg pa thams cad kyi rab mchog chen por gyur pa ni /
translated: The supreme of all Great Vehicles is the vehicle of indestructible reality.🔽The supreme of all vehicles of indestructible reality is the vehicle of the secret mantra.🔽The supreme of all vehicles of the secret mantra is the vehicle of the Great Perfection.🔽The supreme of all vehicles of the Great Perfection is the vehicle of the Innermost Spirituality.

original: gsang sngags kyi theg pa nyid ye shes lnga dang / rigs lnga dang / sku gsum dang / snod nges par gyur pa thams cad ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po yin pas na de'i tshul du bshad pa ni nges pa lnga'i tshul du bshad pa ste dang po'o /

original: // / de ltar rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po ni gsang ba'i chos 'byung ba'i nang du bdud bzhi dang / log par 'dren pa'i bgegs mtha' dag bcom pas na ye shes chen po zhes bya la /
analyzed: // / de ltar rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po ni gsang ba'i chos 'byung ba'i nang du bdud bzhi dang / log par 'dren pa'i bgegs mtha' dag bcom pas na ye shes chen po zhes bya la /
translated: Thus, the great maṇḍala of the vajra realm is called “great gnosis” because it conquers all the māras and obstructors who lead astray within the secret source of phenomena.

original: de bas na rang nyid nges par brtan zhing pha rol gyi tshogs mtha' dag 'joms pas na rdo rje zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na rang nyid nges par brtan zhing pha rol gyi tshogs mtha' dag 'joms pas na rdo rje zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, since it conquers all the hosts of others, it is called “vajra.”

original: 'gro ba nye bar 'dul ba'i tshul gyis sku'i rigs rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i dbyings zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'gro ba nye bar 'dul ba'i tshul gyis sku'i rigs rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i dbyings zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: Since it is the cause of the arising of the various families of the body through the method of taming migrating beings, it is called “the realm.”

original: ye shes chen po de nyid snying po yin la /
analyzed: ye shes chen po de nyid snying po yin la /
translated: That great gnosis is the essence.

original: de rang gis rang rig pa'i tshul gyis dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de rang gis rang rig pa'i tshul gyis dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: Since it is the maṇḍala of the mode of one’s vidyā, it is called “the maṇḍala.”

original: ye shes chen po de nyid kyi dbyings yang dag par rig pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ye shes chen po de nyid kyi dbyings yang dag par rig pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes zhes bya ste /
translated: The realm of that great gnosis is the gnosis of the dharmadhātu.

original: de yang la'u dang pa @246b las ;
analyzed: de yang la'u dang pa @246b las ;
translated: That is also from the syllables lū and pa.

original: ye shes chen po nges ldan pas //
analyzed: ye shes chen po nges ldan pas //
translated: Since it is endowed with great gnosis,

original: shes pa med phyir shes pa ni //
analyzed: shes pa med phyir shes pa ni //
translated: Because of the absence of consciousness, consciousness

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes te //🔽yul dang yul can gcig par bshad //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes te // yul dang yul can gcig par bshad //
translated: is the pristine wisdom of the ultimate realm.

original: ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is explained as the oneness of object and subject.

original: de ltar gong du bstan pa'i ye shes chen po ni shel gyi snying po dag pa ltar dri ma dang bral zhing kun gyi snang ba'i gzhir gyur pas na rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya la /🔽'gro ba rnam par nges pa ston pa'i tshul gyis chos kyi ye shes rnam par snang mdzad du ston pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar gong du bstan pa'i ye shes chen po ni shel gyi snying po dag pa ltar dri ma dang bral zhing kun gyi snang ba'i gzhir gyur pas na rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya la / 'gro ba rnam par nges pa ston pa'i tshul gyis chos kyi ye shes rnam par snang mdzad du ston pa ni /
translated: Thus, the great pristine wisdom taught above is called “Vajrasattva” because it is free from stains like the pure essence of crystal and is the ground of the appearance of all.

original: sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad che //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad che // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The teaching of the pristine wisdom of phenomena as Vairocana by the method of teaching the definite classification of migrating beings is taught by “The Buddha, the great Vairocana.”

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi chos kyi dbyings kyi ston pa ni sangs rgyas zhes bya la shes bya mtha' dag dang bral ba nyid rnam par snang mdzad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi chos kyi dbyings kyi ston pa ni sangs rgyas zhes bya la shes bya mtha' dag dang bral ba nyid rnam par snang mdzad ces bya'o //
translated: The teaching of the ultimate realm of the nondual pristine wisdom is called “Buddha,” and the freedom from all objects of knowledge is called “Vairocana.”

original: thub pa chen po thub chen ldan //
analyzed: thub pa chen po thub chen ldan //
translated: The great sage, the possessor of great sagehood,

original: zhes pa ma dag pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam par bcom pa dang / nye bar 'tshe ba'i bdud kyi tshogs drag po mi bzad pa rnams bcom pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya la /
analyzed: zhes pa ma dag pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam par bcom pa dang / nye bar 'tshe ba'i bdud kyi tshogs drag po mi bzad pa rnams bcom pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya la /
translated: This is called the one who has completely conquered the impure afflictions and the fierce, unbearable hordes of the demon of harm.

original: de nyid thag pa rnams kyi rab mchog chen por gyur pa sngags kyi theg pa la brten nas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid thag pa rnams kyi rab mchog chen por gyur pa sngags kyi theg pa la brten nas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that he is the great, supreme rope, who is fully enlightened by means of the mantra vehicle, is

original: gsang sngags tshul chen las byung ba //
analyzed: gsang sngags tshul chen las byung ba //
translated: arisen from the great way of secret mantra.

original: zhes bya'o // gsang sngags tshul chen bdag nyid can //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // gsang sngags tshul chen bdag nyid can //
translated: The one who has the nature of the great way of secret mantra

original: zhes bya ba ni thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i bde ba spros pa dang bral ba ston ka'i zla ba rgyas pa ltar dri ma dang bral zhing mtha' yas pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi sku bzhugs zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i bde ba spros pa dang bral ba ston ka'i zla ba rgyas pa ltar dri ma dang bral zhing mtha' yas pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi sku bzhugs zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: is the one who is free from the stains of conceptual elaborations, like the full autumn moon, and is the abode of the dharmakāya of all tathāgatas, which is limitless.

original: ci ste gsang sngags kyi tshul gyis las 'byung bas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang mi ldan nam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste gsang sngags kyi tshul gyis las 'byung bas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang mi ldan nam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If one asks, “Are the perfections not present because the deeds arise through the way of mantra?” they are.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang ldan par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang ldan par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that they are present is:

analyzed: pha rol phyin bcu thob pa ste // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The ten perfections are attained.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa bcu ni gong du bstan pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa dang ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du nges par thob pa nyid de /

translated: The ten perfections are definitely attained in the way they were taught above, from generosity up to the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nyid dbul pos nor bu rin po che rnyed nas slar bral ba ltar ma yin zhing pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i tshul gyis 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa bstan pa ni /🔽pha rol phyin pa bcu la gnas //

translated: It is not like a poor person who finds a precious jewel and then loses it. The teaching that he acts for the welfare of beings through the way of the ten perfections is:🔽Abiding in the ten perfections.

original: zhes bya'o // pha rol phyin bcu dag pa ste //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // pha rol phyin bcu dag pa ste //
translated: The ten perfections are pure.

original: zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i bdag nyid theg pa chen por sems bskyed pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa la sogs nges par spyod pa ni pha rol tu @247a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i bdag nyid theg pa chen por sems bskyed pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa la sogs nges par spyod pa ni pha rol tu @247a * //
translated: Thus, the generosity and so on of the bodhisattvas who definitely practice them by generating the mind of the Mahayana in the nature of the contaminated is the perfection.

original: phyin la de nyid zag pa med pa'i tshul gang la mnga' ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: phyin la de nyid zag pa med pa'i tshul gang la mnga' ba de la de skad ces bya'o //

original: 'gro ba rnams la nges par sbyin pa la sogs pa nges par ston pa ni /🔽pha rol phyin pa bcu yi tshul //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams la nges par sbyin pa la sogs pa nges par ston pa ni / pha rol phyin pa bcu yi tshul //
translated: The definite teaching of generosity and so on to beings

original: zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: is the method of the ten perfections.🔽Thus, the dharmadhatu and gnosis are nondual, and that itself is the dharmakaya.

original: de ltar chos kyi dbyings dang ye shes gnyis su med pa ni chos kyi sku yin pa de nyid longs spyod rdzogs pa nyid sa bcu'i dbang phyug tu gyur pa dang sa bcu la nges par gnas pas ni /
analyzed: de ltar chos kyi dbyings dang ye shes gnyis su med pa ni chos kyi sku yin pa de nyid longs spyod rdzogs pa nyid sa bcu'i dbang phyug tu gyur pa dang sa bcu la nges par gnas pas ni /
translated: The lord of the ten bhumis, who is the sambhogakaya, and those who definitely abide on the ten bhumis

original: mgon po sa bcu'i dbang phyug ste //
analyzed: mgon po sa bcu'i dbang phyug ste //
translated: are the lords of the ten bhumis.

original: sa bcu la ni gnas pa po //
analyzed: sa bcu la ni gnas pa po //
translated: They abide on the ten bhumis.

original: zhes bya zhing de nyid gzugs kyi skus gdul bya nges par dag par shes pa bcu la sogs par bcu rnam par dag pa dang / de'i bdag nyid du ldan pas ni /🔽shes bcu rnam dag bdag nyid can //
analyzed: zhes bya zhing de nyid gzugs kyi skus gdul bya nges par dag par shes pa bcu la sogs par bcu rnam par dag pa dang / de'i bdag nyid du ldan pas ni / shes bcu rnam dag bdag nyid can //
translated: And that very one, by means of the form body, is the possessor of the ten knowledges, etc., which are the ten purities of the disciples, and is endowed with the nature of those.🔽He is the possessor of the ten knowledges,

original: shes bcu rnam dag 'chang ba po //🔽zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: shes bcu rnam dag 'chang ba po // zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: and the ten knowledges are pure.

original: rnam pa bcu po don bcu'i don //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu po don bcu'i don //
translated: The ten aspects are the meaning of the ten topics.

original: zhes pa ni gong du bstan pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi bcu dang sa nyi shu dang shes pa nyi shu dang stobs bcu dang dbang bcu ni rnam pa bcu ste brgya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gong du bstan pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi bcu dang sa nyi shu dang shes pa nyi shu dang stobs bcu dang dbang bcu ni rnam pa bcu ste brgya'o //
translated: The ten perfections taught above, the twenty stages, the twenty knowledges, the ten powers, and the ten masteries are the ten aspects, making one hundred.

original: de nyid bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don gyi tshul gyis nyis brgya'o //
analyzed: de nyid bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don gyi tshul gyis nyis brgya'o //
translated: Those are two hundred by way of the manner of one's own benefit and others' benefit.🔽The Lord of Sages is the pervasive lord of the ten powers.

translated: By means of the nature of the ten powers that know the exhaustion of defilements, he abides pervading the entire three realms. That very one is the one to be shown.

original: kun gyi don ni ma lus byed //
analyzed: kun gyi don ni ma lus byed //
translated: It performs all the aims of all.

original: ces bya zhing gong gi dbang bcu bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ces bya zhing gong gi dbang bcu bstan pa ni /
translated: The ten powers mentioned above are indicated by

original: rnam bcu dbang ldan che ba po //
analyzed: rnam bcu dbang ldan che ba po //

analyzed: zhes pa ste sems la dbang ba la sogs pa'i dbang tshogs pa'i bdag nyid chen po dang ldan par bstan pa nyid do //

original: de lta bu'i yon tan mtshungs pa med pa rnams glo bur ba nyid kyis bskyed dam 'on te ngo bo nyid kyis gnas snyam pa la /
analyzed: de lta bu'i yon tan mtshungs pa med pa rnams glo bur ba nyid kyis bskyed dam 'on te ngo bo nyid kyis gnas snyam pa la /
translated: Since such incomparable qualities are adventitious, one may wonder whether they are produced or whether they abide by their very essence.🔽The first verse of the chapter states:

original: thog ma med pa spros med bdag / ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: thog ma med pa spros med bdag / ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The beginningless, unelaborate nature

original: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dpag tu med pa thams cad ni thogs pa med pa nas spros pa dang bral ba las mtshan nyid du gnas pa nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yon tan mtshan nyid de ni chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid kyi bdag por gyur pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dpag tu med pa thams cad ni thogs pa med pa nas spros pa dang bral ba las mtshan nyid du gnas pa nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yon tan mtshan nyid de ni chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid kyi bdag por gyur pa dang /
translated: All the immeasurable qualities of the buddhas are characterized by the absence of obstruction and the absence of elaboration. The nature of the qualities of all the tathagatas is the lord of the dharmadhatu suchness.

original: rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid gnas pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid gnas pa ni /
translated: The abiding of the pure nature is

analyzed: de bzhin nyid dag dag pa'i bdag / ces bya'o //

analyzed: rgyu rnam par dag pa las 'bras bu rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyis lam rnam par dag pa ston pa ni /
translated: The path is taught to be pure by the characteristic of the pure effect from the pure cause.

original: bden @247b par smra zhing tshig mi 'gyur //
analyzed: bden @247b par smra zhing tshig mi 'gyur //
translated: One speaks the truth and one's word is not changed.

original: zhes bya la lam nges pa las 'bras bu nges par 'byin pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya la lam nges pa las 'bras bu nges par 'byin pa ni /
translated: From the path of certainty, the effect of certainty is produced.

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin byed //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin byed //
translated: One does what one says.

original: ces bya zhing de nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba las dbyings dang ye shes gnyis su med par lhun gyis grub par ston pa nyid de /🔽gnyis med gnyis su med par ston //
analyzed: ces bya zhing de nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba las dbyings dang ye shes gnyis su med par lhun gyis grub par ston pa nyid de / gnyis med gnyis su med par ston //
translated: That itself is free from the concepts of subject and object, and it is taught to be spontaneously present as the nondual basic field and pristine awareness.

analyzed: zhes bya ba nyid do // de ltar bya ba la sogs pa dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bzhugs gnas /

analyzed: zhing khams chen po yang dam pa'i mtha' spros pa dang bral ba yin la /
translated: Thus, the abode of all tathāgatas of the three times, such as action, is the great realm of the ultimate, free from conceptual elaborations.

analyzed: de la rnam par gnas nas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par mdzad pa ni ;

analyzed: yang dag mtha' la rnam par gnas //

original: zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyid do //

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing khams chen po bdag nyid ji lta bu zhig gnas snyam pa la /

analyzed: bdag med seng ge'i sgra dang ldan //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs la /

translated: In the Akaniṣṭha realm that is concordant with that activity, there is a celestial mansion of various jewels, the nature of the five pure sense desirables, and the great perfect enjoyment of the Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa ni seng ge'i rgyal po ltar gzhan gyi sgrib pa 'phrog cing sun 'byin pa rnams skrag par byed pas ni /

original: mu stegs ri dags ngan 'jigs byed //
analyzed: mu stegs ri dags ngan 'jigs byed //

original: ces bya ste de dag ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: ces bya ste de dag ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yid ltar mgyogs //
translated: is as swift as the mind of the tathāgatas.

translated: This is the perfection of the means of accomplishing the benefit of all the worlds of the great trichiliocosm, and the various emanated forms that are produced in accordance with the aspirations of those to be tamed.🔽This is the perfection of the means of accomplishing the benefit of all the worlds of the great trichiliocosm, and the various emanated forms that are produced in accordance with the aspirations of those to be tamed.🔽This is the perfection of the means of accomplishing the benefit of all the worlds of the great trichiliocosm, and the various emanated forms that are produced in accordance with the aspirations of those to be tamed.

analyzed: chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang // sprul sku'i ston pa de bzhugs so // zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // bdag nyid chen po'i ston ba de dag yon tan ji lta bu dang ldan zhe na /
translated: This is the perfection of the means of accomplishing the benefit of all the worlds of the great trichiliocosm, and the various emanated forms that are produced in accordance with the aspirations of those to be tamed.🔽This is the perfection of the means of accomplishing the benefit of all the worlds of the great trichiliocosm, and the various emanated forms that are produced in accordance with the aspirations of those to be tamed.

analyzed: rgyal ba dgra rgyal rnam par rgyal //
translated: This is the perfection of the means of accomplishing the benefit of all the worlds of the great trichiliocosm, and the various emanated forms that are produced in accordance with the aspirations of those to be tamed.🔽This is the perfection of the means of accomplishing the benefit of all the worlds of the great trichiliocosm, and the various emanated forms that are produced in accordance with the aspirations of those to be tamed.

analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te ;🔽bdag dang gzhan gyi rnam par rtog pa ni gnod par byed pas dgra bo yin la /
translated: This is the perfection of the means of accomplishing the benefit of all the worlds of the great trichiliocosm, and the various emanated forms

original: de la ston pa chen po rnam par rtog pa mi skye ba'i tshul gyis rab tu rgyal la /
analyzed: de la ston pa chen po rnam par rtog pa mi skye ba'i tshul gyis rab tu rgyal la /
translated: The great teacher is called Vairocana, the one who is victorious in the manner of non-arising thoughts.

original: de sangs rgyas kyi zhing khams thams cad dang / sems can gyi zhing khams thams cad du yongs su dag pa'i tshul gyis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bas na /
analyzed: de sangs rgyas kyi zhing khams thams cad dang / sems can gyi zhing khams thams cad du yongs su dag pa'i tshul gyis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bas na /
translated: Since he turns the wheel of dharma in all the buddhafields and all the fields of sentient beings in the manner of complete purity,

original: 'khor los sgyur ba stobs po che //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba stobs po che //
translated: he is called the great powerful chakravartin.🔽He is the master of the assembly, the supreme of assemblies,

original: zhes bya'o // tshogs kyi slob dpon tshogs kyi mchog / tshogs rje tshogs bdag dang ldan //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // tshogs kyi slob dpon tshogs kyi mchog / tshogs rje tshogs bdag dang ldan //
translated: the lord of the assembly, and endowed with the lord of the assembly.

original: zhes pa la gong du bstan pa'i chos kyi sku ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa ni mang po 'dus pa rnams kyi mchog yin la /
analyzed: zhes pa la gong du bstan pa'i chos kyi sku ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa ni mang po 'dus pa rnams kyi mchog yin la /
translated: The dharmakaya, which was taught above, is the perfection of the assembly of merit and wisdom. It is the supreme of all the assemblies.

original: des 'gro ba'i phan pa'i rgyu legs pa'i spyod pa kun ston pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa 'byung ba la de skad ces bya zhing /
analyzed: des 'gro ba'i phan pa'i rgyu legs pa'i spyod pa kun ston pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa 'byung ba la de skad ces bya zhing /
translated: It is endowed with the characteristics of the appearance of the cause of the benefit of beings, the teacher of all good conduct.

original: de sa bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rje bor gyur pa dang / khams gsum la dbang sgyur ba'i phyir bya ba rdzogs par yongs su grub pa nyid do ;
analyzed: de sa bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rje bor gyur pa dang / khams gsum la dbang sgyur ba'i phyir bya ba rdzogs par yongs su grub pa nyid do ;
translated: It is the perfect accomplishment of action, because it is the master of the bodhisattvas on the ten stages and because it controls the three realms.

original: / mthu chen gces par 'dzin pa ste //🔽zhes pa ni sku gsum la ye shes chen po'i bdag nyid las dus gzhan yid du 'ong ba med do //
analyzed: / mthu chen gces par 'dzin pa ste // zhes pa ni sku gsum la ye shes chen po'i bdag nyid las dus gzhan yid du 'ong ba med do //
translated: It is the great power, the cherished one.

original: de nyid nyams su myong ba med pas nges par 'dzin pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid nyams su myong ba med pas nges par 'dzin pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: This is because there is no other time than the one that is the nature of the great intuition of the three bodies, and because it is the cherished one, which is the intuition of that very reality.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bdag nyid nges pa'i tshul gyis yongs su rdzogs shing gzhan du bstan du med la gzhan la rag ma lus pa nyid de /

translated: It is the perfect fulfillment of the nature of the self, which is the perfect fulfillment of the aims of self and other, and it is not taught as something else, not dependent on anything else.

original: de'i phyir na /
analyzed: de'i phyir na /
translated: Therefore,

original: tshul chen gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog / ces bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: tshul chen gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog / ces bya ba nyid do //
translated: it is the great way, not dependent on another.

original: tshig rje tshig bdag smra mkhas pa //
analyzed: tshig rje tshig bdag smra mkhas pa //
translated: It is the lord of speech, the master of speech, the skilled speaker.

original: zhes pa ni 'jam dpal nyid nges par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'jam dpal nyid nges par 'byung ba ste /
translated: This is the very Mañjuśrī, the one who goes forth.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi tshul gyis 'di yang 'jam dpal gyi bdag nyid yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi tshul gyis 'di yang 'jam dpal gyi bdag nyid yin par dgongs so //
translated: And because of the way in which he has the gnosis of the expanse of reality, he is also the very nature of Manjushri.

original: sprul pa'i gsung de nyid tshig gi tshogs thams cad la dbang zhing tshig gi brjod pa mtha' yas pa dang ldan pa'i don ston pa dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa bzhis 'phags pa nyan thos rnams 'dul @248b bar ston pa ni /
analyzed: sprul pa'i gsung de nyid tshig gi tshogs thams cad la dbang zhing tshig gi brjod pa mtha' yas pa dang ldan pa'i don ston pa dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa bzhis 'phags pa nyan thos rnams 'dul @248b bar ston pa ni /
translated: The emanation body has power over all the collections of words and teaches the meaning that has infinite verbal expressions, and he teaches the training of the noble shravakas through the four noble truths such as suffering.

original: tshig la dbang ba tshig mtha' yas //
analyzed: tshig la dbang ba tshig mtha' yas //
translated: He has power over words, infinite words.

original: tshig bden pa dang bden par smra //
analyzed: tshig bden pa dang bden par smra //
translated: He is truthful and speaks the truth.

original: bden pa bzhi ni ston pa po //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi ni ston pa po //
translated: He is the teacher of the four noble truths.

original: phyir mi ldog pa phyir mi 'ong //🔽zhes bya ba nyid do //
