analyzed: mchog tu gyur pa'i bdag nyid kyi las kyi phyag rgya la phyi rol gyi mngon par zhen pa dang bral bar gnas pa la de skad ces bya zhing /
translated: The supreme nature of the karmamudra is free from external attachment, and so it is called that.

original: de nyid padma dang rdo rje snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba rnyed pa la so so la sogs pa'i mngon par shes pas ngan 'gro'i rgyur gyur cing 'bras bu 'jigs pa dang bral ba'i bde ba thob pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid padma dang rdo rje snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba rnyed pa la so so la sogs pa'i mngon par shes pas ngan 'gro'i rgyur gyur cing 'bras bu 'jigs pa dang bral ba'i bde ba thob pa ni /
translated: That very one, having attained the bliss of the union of the lotus and vajra, attains the bliss free from the fear of the result that is the cause of the lower realms through the clairvoyance of each one, and so on.

original: bde ba rnyed pas 'jigs med thob //
analyzed: bde ba rnyed pas 'jigs med thob //
translated: Attaining bliss, one attains fearlessness.

original: ces bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: ces bya ba nyid do //
translated: That is the meaning of the verse.

original: las kyi phyag rgya'i bde ba des rnam par rtog pa 'ching ba'i mdud pa med pa dang 'dra bar bdag gi rgyur gdung zhing sreg par byed pa 'jigs par mdzad pa dang / phyin ci log gi shes pa nub par mdzad pas na /
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya'i bde ba des rnam par rtog pa 'ching ba'i mdud pa med pa dang 'dra bar bdag gi rgyur gdung zhing sreg par byed pa 'jigs par mdzad pa dang / phyin ci log gi shes pa nub par mdzad pas na /
translated: The bliss of the karmamudra is like the absence of the knot that binds the conceptual thoughts. It is the fear that burns and torments as the cause of the self, and it is the one that causes the setting of the consciousness of error.

original: bsil bar gyur pas rnyog pa med //
analyzed: bsil bar gyur pas rnyog pa med //
translated: Therefore, it is the cool one, free of turbidity.

original: ces bya zhing phyi rol gyi rig pa thabs su ldan pas na nang gi shes rab dang thabs bskyed ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya zhing phyi rol gyi rig pa thabs su ldan pas na nang gi shes rab dang thabs bskyed ba ni /
translated: And since it is endowed with the external knowledge of the means, it is the inner generation of wisdom and means.

original: rig pa dang ni rkang par ldan //
analyzed: rig pa dang ni rkang par ldan //
translated: It is endowed with knowledge and feet.

original: zhes bya'o // thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i bde ba chen po de'i rang gi ngo bo ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i bde ba chen po de'i rang gi ngo bo ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of that great bliss of the nondual union of means and wisdom?

original: bde gshegs 'jig rten rig ba'i mchog / ces bya ba gsungs te zag pa med pa'i bde ba rtogs pa dang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi dus gsum dang / khams gsum pa thams cad gnyis su med pa'i bdag nyid rig cing 'jig rten pa'i mngon par shes pa las gong du 'gyur bas na de skad ces @249a * //
analyzed: bde gshegs 'jig rten rig ba'i mchog / ces bya ba gsungs te zag pa med pa'i bde ba rtogs pa dang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi dus gsum dang / khams gsum pa thams cad gnyis su med pa'i bdag nyid rig cing 'jig rten pa'i mngon par shes pa las gong du 'gyur bas na de skad ces @249a * //
translated: It is the supreme knowledge of the bliss of the sugatas, the world, and the highest, because it is the realization of uncontaminated bliss, the knowledge of the three times—past, future, and present—and the nondual nature of the entire three realms.

original: bya zhing / de nyid la thabs dang shes rab kyi rnam par dbye ba'i chos rjes su 'gro ba med par rang rig pa'i ngo bor gnas pas na /
analyzed: bya zhing / de nyid la thabs dang shes rab kyi rnam par dbye ba'i chos rjes su 'gro ba med par rang rig pa'i ngo bor gnas pas na /
translated: And since it abides in the essence of self-knowing awareness without the attributes of the division of means and wisdom following it,

original: bdag gir mi 'dzin ngar mi 'dzin //
analyzed: bdag gir mi 'dzin ngar mi 'dzin //
translated: it does not grasp “mine” and does not grasp “I.”

original: zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: This is so.

original: ci don dam pa'i bden pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci don dam pa'i bden pa yin zhe na /
translated: Is it ultimate truth?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid de gzhan gyi don brtson pa dang bral lam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid de gzhan gyi don brtson pa dang bral lam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: It is the nature of all the transcendent ones, and is it devoid of striving for the benefit of others? No, it is not.

original: bden pa gnyis kyi tshul la gnas //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis kyi tshul la gnas //
translated: It abides in the mode of the two truths.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: This is stated.

original: de la bden pa gnyis ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa yin la /
analyzed: de la bden pa gnyis ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa yin la /
translated: The two truths are the relative and the ultimate.🔽The relative is the two form bodies, which are like the moon for all sentient beings, and the ultimate is the great bliss that transcends verbal expression.

original: kun rdzob ni gzugs sku rnam pa gnyis ni rgyu byang chub rnam pa gnyis kyis sems can kunda lta bu nyid dang / don dam pa ni bde ba chen po ngag gi brjod pa las 'das pa nyid yin par gsungs te de yang le'u dang po las /
analyzed: kun rdzob ni gzugs sku rnam pa gnyis ni rgyu byang chub rnam pa gnyis kyis sems can kunda lta bu nyid dang / don dam pa ni bde ba chen po ngag gi brjod pa las 'das pa nyid yin par gsungs te de yang le'u dang po las /
translated: This is stated in the first chapter:

original: kun rdzob don dam dbye ba las //
analyzed: kun rdzob don dam dbye ba las //
translated: From the division of the relative and the ultimate,

original: byang chub sems ni rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni rnam pa gnyis //
translated: there are two kinds of awakening mind.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don grub phyir //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don grub phyir //
translated: In order to accomplish the benefit of self and other,

original: kunda lta bur dbye ba yin //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kunda lta bur dbye ba yin //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is divided like the moon.

original: de nyid 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las pha rol tu phyin cing kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba thams cad dang bral bas yang dag pa'i mtha' gnas pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las pha rol tu phyin cing kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba thams cad dang bral bas yang dag pa'i mtha' gnas pa ni /
translated: That very [great bliss] has gone beyond the ocean of samsara and, being free from all afflictions and purities, it is the abiding of the limit of reality.

original: 'khor ba'i pha rol mthar son pa //🔽bya ba byas pa skam sar gnas //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i pha rol mthar son pa // bya ba byas pa skam sar gnas //
translated: It has reached the end of the far shore of samsara.

original: zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: Having done what was to be done, it abides on dry land.

original: de lta bu'i bde ba chen po de ye shes kyi ngo bor gsal bas shes bya mtha' dag la spyod cing pha rol gyi tshogs 'joms pas gzhan bskyod pas na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i bde ba chen po de ye shes kyi ngo bor gsal bas shes bya mtha' dag la spyod cing pha rol gyi tshogs 'joms pas gzhan bskyod pas na /
translated: Since such great bliss is manifest as the essence of wisdom, it engages with all objects of knowledge and, since it conquers the hosts of others, it moves others.

original: shes pa 'ba' zhig nges gsal ba //
analyzed: shes pa 'ba' zhig nges gsal ba //
translated: It is only consciousness that is ascertained.

original: shes rab mtshon chen rnam 'joms pa //🔽zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: shes rab mtshon chen rnam 'joms pa // zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: Wisdom is the great weapon that conquers all.

original: de chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ston par gyur cing bde ba gsal bar gyur pa ni /
analyzed: de chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ston par gyur cing bde ba gsal bar gyur pa ni /
translated: Since that [great bliss] is the nature of the dharmakaya, it is the teacher of all tathagatas and the manifest bliss.

original: dam chos chos rgyal gsal bar ldan //
analyzed: dam chos chos rgyal gsal bar ldan //
translated: It possesses the manifest, holy Dharma, the king of Dharma.

original: zhes bya la rang gi lus dang ngag dang yid gsum ma rig pa'i rkyen las nges par bzlog pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya la rang gi lus dang ngag dang yid gsum ma rig pa'i rkyen las nges par bzlog pa ni /
translated: The phrase one's body, speech, and mind are definitely turned away from the condition of ignorance🔽refers to the line the supreme illuminator of the world.🔽 That very [mahāmudrā] is the inexhaustible treasury of Dharma and the path of mahāmudrā, which is like a subtle bird's path.

original: 'jig rten snang bar byed pa'i mchog / ces bya ste de nyid chos kyi mdzod zad mi shes pa dang / phyag rgya chen po lam phra phab pa lta bu rtog pa dang bral ba nyid rang nyid la ston par byed pa ni ;
analyzed: 'jig rten snang bar byed pa'i mchog / ces bya ste de nyid chos kyi mdzod zad mi shes pa dang / phyag rgya chen po lam phra phab pa lta bu rtog pa dang bral ba nyid rang nyid la ston par byed pa ni ;
translated: The one who reveals it to oneself is

original: chos kyi dbang phyug chos kyi rgyal la sogs /
analyzed: chos kyi dbang phyug chos kyi rgyal la sogs /
translated: the lord of Dharma, the king of Dharma, and so on.

original: legs pa'i lam ni ston pa po nyid do //
analyzed: legs pa'i lam ni ston pa po nyid do //
translated: He is the one who reveals the excellent path.

original: don grub bsam pa grub pa ste //
analyzed: don grub bsam pa grub pa ste //
translated: The line the one who accomplishes the purpose, the one who accomplishes the intention

original: zhes pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i tshul gyis phyag rgya chen po nyid don dam pa yin la /
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i tshul gyis phyag rgya chen po nyid don dam pa yin la /
translated: refers to mahāmudrā itself, which is the ultimate in the manner of nonconceptuality.

original: de nyid bsam pa grub cing de las gzhan bsgrub bya med pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid bsam pa grub cing de las gzhan bsgrub bya med pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Since that very [mahāmudrā] is the accomplishment of the intention and there is nothing else to accomplish, it is called that.

original: de nyid @249b 'jig rten pa'i gnas dang lus dang longs spyod du rnam par rtog pa spangs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa nyid ye shes dpag tu med pa rnams 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pas skad cig ma'i ye shes ltar zad pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid @249b 'jig rten pa'i gnas dang lus dang longs spyod du rnam par rtog pa spangs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa nyid ye shes dpag tu med pa rnams 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pas skad cig ma'i ye shes ltar zad pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: It is free from the imagination of the world as a place, a body, and enjoyments, and it is the cause of the arising of the immeasurable intuitions, since it is not exhausted like the intuitions of the moment.

original: kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs //
analyzed: kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs //
translated: It is free from all imagination.

original: rnam par mi rtog dbyings mi zad //🔽ces bya'o // chos dbyings dam pa zad mi shes //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog dbyings mi zad // ces bya'o // chos dbyings dam pa zad mi shes //
translated: The nonconceptual realm is inexhaustible.

original: zhes bya ba ni de nyid chos kyi dbyings yin la ye shes rnams kyi mchog tu gyur pa dang gong gi tshul gyis de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de nyid chos kyi dbyings yin la ye shes rnams kyi mchog tu gyur pa dang gong gi tshul gyis de skad ces bya'o //
translated: This is the ultimate realm, and it is the best of the intuitions, as was explained above.

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i phyag rgya chen po de bsod nams kyi 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pas gdul bya'i skye bo rnams mngon par dad cing mchod pa dang / bdud rtsi mtha' dag gi gnas su gyur pas na /
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i phyag rgya chen po de bsod nams kyi 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pas gdul bya'i skye bo rnams mngon par dad cing mchod pa dang / bdud rtsi mtha' dag gi gnas su gyur pas na /
translated: That supreme, unchanging, great seal is the accumulation of the merit of the disciples, since it is the object of their faith and worship, and it is the abode of all ambrosia.

original: bsod nams ldan pa bsod nams tshogs //
analyzed: bsod nams ldan pa bsod nams tshogs //
translated: It is endowed with merit, the accumulation of merit.

original: zhes bya zhing de las kyi phyag rgya las 'byung ba skad cig gcig ma'i ye shes dang / chos kyi phyag rgya las 'byung ba dus kyi ye shes dang / phyag rgya chen po las 'byung ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i ye shes nyid du gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya zhing de las kyi phyag rgya las 'byung ba skad cig gcig ma'i ye shes dang / chos kyi phyag rgya las 'byung ba dus kyi ye shes dang / phyag rgya chen po las 'byung ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i ye shes nyid du gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: The wisdom that arises from the karmamudra is the instantaneous wisdom, the wisdom that arises from the dharmamudra is the wisdom of time, and the wisdom that arises from the mahamudra is the uninterrupted wisdom.

original: ye shes ye shes 'byung gnas che //🔽ye shes ldan pa yod med shes //
analyzed: ye shes ye shes 'byung gnas che // ye shes ldan pa yod med shes //
translated: The great source of wisdom

original: zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: The one endowed with wisdom knows existence and nonexistence.

original: de bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mnyam pa med pa yongs su rdzogs pa na /
analyzed: de bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mnyam pa med pa yongs su rdzogs pa na /
translated: When the accumulations of merit and wisdom are completed without equal,

original: tshogs gnyis tshogs ni bsags pa po //
analyzed: tshogs gnyis tshogs ni bsags pa po //
translated: The one who has accumulated the two accumulations

original: zhes bya la skad cig ma'i ye shes ltar mi rtog pa ma yin pa dang / dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan chen po yongs su bsngags shing dus gsum gyi ye shes ltar mnyam par gzhag pa dang ma gzhag pa mi mnga' bas na /
analyzed: zhes bya la skad cig ma'i ye shes ltar mi rtog pa ma yin pa dang / dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan chen po yongs su bsngags shing dus gsum gyi ye shes ltar mnyam par gzhag pa dang ma gzhag pa mi mnga' bas na /
translated: The nonconceptual wisdom is not like the instantaneous wisdom, and the great qualities of all the buddhas of the three times are completely praised. Since there is no distinction between equipoise and nonequipoise like the wisdom of the three times,

original: rtag pa kun rgyal rnal 'byor can //
analyzed: rtag pa kun rgyal rnal 'byor can //
translated: The constant yogi who conquers all

original: zhes bya ste de'i bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dang sgrub pa po gnyis su rdzogs pa'i bdag nyid dbyer mi phyed par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ste de'i bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dang sgrub pa po gnyis su rdzogs pa'i bdag nyid dbyer mi phyed par gyur pa ni /
translated: Thus, the object of attainment, the means of attainment, and the attainer are all of indivisible nature.

original: bsam gtan bsam bya blo ldan bdag / ces bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: bsam gtan bsam bya blo ldan bdag / ces bya ba nyid do //
translated: The wise one’s concentration is the self.

original: de ltar chos kyi sku yongs su dag pa'i bdag nyid de ni spros pa thams cad dang bral ba rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sa bon du gyur pa rigs gcig pa'i bdag nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: de ltar chos kyi sku yongs su dag pa'i bdag nyid de ni spros pa thams cad dang bral ba rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sa bon du gyur pa rigs gcig pa'i bdag nyid yin pas na /
translated: Thus, the nature of the completely pure Dharma body is free from all conceptual elaborations and endowed with the most sublime of all aspects. It is the seed of all buddhas and is of the nature of the single family.

original: so so rang rig mi g-yo ba //
analyzed: so so rang rig mi g-yo ba //
translated: It is the individual self-cognizance, the immovable,

original: mchog gi dang po zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: mchog gi dang po zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: The supreme first.

original: bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa nyid rigs gcig phun sum tshogs pa'i nges pa yin yang bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid las gdul bya rnams kyi 'dod chags dang zhe sdang @250a * //
analyzed: bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa nyid rigs gcig phun sum tshogs pa'i nges pa yin yang bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid las gdul bya rnams kyi 'dod chags dang zhe sdang @250a * //
translated: Although the perfection of one’s own goal is the certainty of the perfection of the single family, the activity of the wisdom of accomplishing activities is the perfection of others’ goals.

original: dang gti mug rnams 'dul ba'i tshul gyis sku gsung thugs su bstan pa ni rnam par snang mdzad dang / 'od dpag med dang / mi bskyod pa rnams te /
analyzed: dang gti mug rnams 'dul ba'i tshul gyis sku gsung thugs su bstan pa ni rnam par snang mdzad dang / 'od dpag med dang / mi bskyod pa rnams te /
translated: The teaching of the three vajras of body, speech, and mind by way of subduing the three poisons is Vairochana, Amitabha, and Akshobhya.

original: sku gsum 'chang zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: sku gsum 'chang zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: The one who holds the three bodies is just that.

original: de nas yang gdul bya rnams la theg pa chen por sems bskyed pa dang / sems bskyed pa la gsang ba gsum gyi dbang bskur ba la sogs pa rnams nyid kyi mtshan nyid yongs su rdzogs pa'i chos grub pa dang / chos grub pa las 'gro ba sgrol ba'i phrin las mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: de nas yang gdul bya rnams la theg pa chen por sems bskyed pa dang / sems bskyed pa la gsang ba gsum gyi dbang bskur ba la sogs pa rnams nyid kyi mtshan nyid yongs su rdzogs pa'i chos grub pa dang / chos grub pa las 'gro ba sgrol ba'i phrin las mdzad pa dang /
translated: Then, for the sake of the disciples, the generation of the mind of enlightenment in the Mahayana, the bestowal of the empowerment of the three secrets on the generated mind, and so on, are the accomplishment of the Dharma of the complete characteristics of the one who accomplishes the Dharma, the performance of the activity of liberating migrating beings,

original: de nyid 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo gnas pa'i phyir rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag tu med pa dang / don yod grub pa rnams su bstan pa ni rigs lnga ste /
analyzed: de nyid 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo gnas pa'i phyir rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag tu med pa dang / don yod grub pa rnams su bstan pa ni rigs lnga ste /
translated: and the teaching of Vairochana, Akshobhya, Ratnasambhava, Amitabha, and Amoghasiddhi because of abiding as the nature of luminosity.

original: sangs rgyas sku lnga'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sku lnga'i bdag nyid can //
translated: The one who has the nature of the five buddha bodies

original: zhes bya zhing da dag nyid chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid du gnas pas na /
analyzed: zhes bya zhing da dag nyid chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid du gnas pas na /
translated: And since those very five pristine consciousnesses abide as the nature of the five pristine consciousnesses, such as the pristine consciousness of the dharmadhatu,

original: khyab bdag ye shes lnga yi bdag / ces bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: khyab bdag ye shes lnga yi bdag / ces bya ba nyid do //
translated: it is said, “the lord of the five pristine consciousnesses.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga nyid ni rigs kyi bdag po yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga nyid ni rigs kyi bdag po yin la /
translated: The five tathagatas are the lords of the families.

original: de rnams ni nam mkha' las byung ba'i nor bu rin po ches dbang bskur zhing rin po che rtse gsum gyis mtshan pas dbu brgyan pa yin la /
analyzed: de rnams ni nam mkha' las byung ba'i nor bu rin po ches dbang bskur zhing rin po che rtse gsum gyis mtshan pas dbu brgyan pa yin la /
translated: They are empowered by the precious jewel that arises from space and are crowned with a crest of the precious three-pointed jewel.

original: de rnams kyi sprul pa byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs dpag tu med pa rnams la /
analyzed: de rnams kyi sprul pa byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs dpag tu med pa rnams la /
translated: The assembly of immeasurable bodhisattvas emanated from them

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam lngas cod pan du byas shing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam lngas cod pan du byas shing /
translated: are crowned with the five tathagatas.

original: lha'i spyan la sogs pa lnga rnam par dag pas 'gro ba rnams 'dul bar mdzad pas na /
analyzed: lha'i spyan la sogs pa lnga rnam par dag pas 'gro ba rnams 'dul bar mdzad pas na /
translated: Since they tame migrating beings with the five pure eyes, such as the divine eye,

original: sangs rgyas mnga' bdag cod pan can //🔽spyan lnga chags pa med pa 'chang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mnga' bdag cod pan can // spyan lnga chags pa med pa 'chang //
translated: it is said, “the lord of the buddhas.”

original: zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: “The five eyes are free of attachment.”

original: sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pa po //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pa po //
translated: The five pristine consciousnesses are the nature of the five buddhas.

original: zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs pa rnams kyi yongs 'dzin dag pa rnams rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i bdag nyid du bskyed pa ni de skad ces bya zhing /
analyzed: zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs pa rnams kyi yongs 'dzin dag pa rnams rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i bdag nyid du bskyed pa ni de skad ces bya zhing /
translated: This is called the generation of the bodhisattvas' pure retinue into the nature of perfect enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sras po dam par gyur pas na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sras po dam par gyur pas na /
translated: Since the bodhisattvas are the sublime sons of all the buddhas of the three times,

original: sangs rgyas sras po dam pa'i mchog / ces bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras po dam pa'i mchog / ces bya'o //
translated: they are called the sublime sons of the buddhas.

original: shes pa srid 'byung skye gnas med //
analyzed: shes pa srid 'byung skye gnas med //
translated: They have no birth in existence.

original: ces pa ni /
analyzed: ces pa ni /
translated: This is

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ye shes kyi lus dang ldan pas na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ye shes kyi lus dang ldan pas na /
translated: because the bodhisattvas have bodies of wisdom.

original: 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor 'gro ba rnams nges par 'byung ba'i don du srid pa len par mdzad kyang /🔽srid pa'i nyes pas mi gos pa yin la de dag @250b las byung bas ngan 'gro las skyob par mdzad pa nyid kyis kyang /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor 'gro ba rnams nges par 'byung ba'i don du srid pa len par mdzad kyang / srid pa'i nyes pas mi gos pa yin la de dag @250b las byung bas ngan 'gro las skyob par mdzad pa nyid kyis kyang /
translated: For the sake of liberating beings in the ocean of samsara, they take birth in existence,🔽but they are not tainted by the faults of existence.

original: chos las 'byung ba srid pa sel //
analyzed: chos las 'byung ba srid pa sel //
translated: Since they arise from the Dharma, they protect from the lower realms.

original: zhes bya'o // ye shes kyi lus nyid srid pa la sogs pa'i gnod pas dbyer mi phyed cing /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // ye shes kyi lus nyid srid pa la sogs pa'i gnod pas dbyer mi phyed cing /
translated: Thus, the body of gnosis itself is indivisible from the harm of existence and so forth.

original: 'bras bu'i bdag nyid yongs su rdzogs pa ma skyes pa nyid na 'gro ba rnams la phan par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i bdag nyid yongs su rdzogs pa ma skyes pa nyid na 'gro ba rnams la phan par gyur pa ni /
translated: When the nature of the result is fully perfected, it is unborn and benefits migrating beings.

original: gcig pu sra mkhregs rdo rje'i bdag / skyes ma thag pa 'gro ba'i bdag / ces bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: gcig pu sra mkhregs rdo rje'i bdag / skyes ma thag pa 'gro ba'i bdag / ces bya ba nyid do //
translated: It is the sole, hard, vajra nature, the nature of migrating beings as soon as they are born.

original: nam mkha' las byung rang 'byung ba //
analyzed: nam mkha' las byung rang 'byung ba //
translated: Arisen from space, self-arisen,

original: shes rab ye shes me bo che //
analyzed: shes rab ye shes me bo che //
translated: the great fire of wisdom gnosis.

original: zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos kyi sku nam mkha' dang 'dra ba las ma skyes pa'i tshul gyis rang 'byung de nyid shes rab phun sum tshogs pa stong pa nyid dang / ye shes chen po'i rang bzhin snying rjes sems can rnams kyi ngan 'gro'i rgyud sreg par byed pas na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos kyi sku nam mkha' dang 'dra ba las ma skyes pa'i tshul gyis rang 'byung de nyid shes rab phun sum tshogs pa stong pa nyid dang / ye shes chen po'i rang bzhin snying rjes sems can rnams kyi ngan 'gro'i rgyud sreg par byed pas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas, from the space-like dharmakāya, self-arise in the manner of non-arising. That itself is the nature of perfect wisdom, emptiness, and great gnosis. Since compassion burns the continuum of bad migrations of sentient beings, it is called that.

original: de lta bu las mi shes pa'i bdag nyid sel bar byed pas ni /
analyzed: de lta bu las mi shes pa'i bdag nyid sel bar byed pas ni /
translated: From such a state, the nature of ignorance is removed.

original: 'od chen rnam par snang bar byed //🔽ye shes snang ba lam me ba //
analyzed: 'od chen rnam par snang bar byed // ye shes snang ba lam me ba //
translated: The great light, the illuminator.🔽The shining light of wisdom,

original: 'gro ba'i mar me ye shes sgron //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i mar me ye shes sgron //
translated: The lamp of the world, the lamp of wisdom,

original: gzi brjid chen po 'od gsal ba //
analyzed: gzi brjid chen po 'od gsal ba //
translated: The great splendor, the clear light.

original: zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: This is what it says.

original: de nas 'gro ba rnams kyi yid skyob par mdzad pa nyid dang / gtum pa chen po'i tshul gyis tshangs pa la sogs pa'i bstan pa nges par 'jig pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa la gsang zhing don gyi mchog phun sum tshogs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de nas 'gro ba rnams kyi yid skyob par mdzad pa nyid dang / gtum pa chen po'i tshul gyis tshangs pa la sogs pa'i bstan pa nges par 'jig pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa la gsang zhing don gyi mchog phun sum tshogs par byed pa ni /
translated: Then, in order to protect the minds of beings and to destroy the teachings of Brahma and so forth through the method of great wrath, and to keep secret from the shravakas and so forth and to accomplish the supreme goal,

original: gsang sngags mnga' bdag rig sngags rgyal //
analyzed: gsang sngags mnga' bdag rig sngags rgyal //
translated: The lord of secret mantra, the king of knowledge mantras,

original: gsang sangs rgyal bo don chen byed //
analyzed: gsang sangs rgyal bo don chen byed //
translated: The secret Buddha, the one who accomplishes the great meaning.

original: ces bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: ces bya ba nyid do //
translated: This is what it says.🔽The great crown protrusion, the wondrous crown protrusion,

original: gtsug tor chen po rmad 'byung gtsug / ces pa ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin la sogs pa ste rgyal chen rnams kyi nor bu rin po che'i cod pan gyis zhabs la gtugs nas /
analyzed: gtsug tor chen po rmad 'byung gtsug / ces pa ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin la sogs pa ste rgyal chen rnams kyi nor bu rin po che'i cod pan gyis zhabs la gtugs nas /
translated: means that the great kings, such as gods, humans, asuras, and so forth, touch their jeweled crown ornaments to his feet

original: mchog chen por byas pa nyid la de skad ces bya zhing /
analyzed: mchog chen por byas pa nyid la de skad ces bya zhing /
translated: and make him the greatest. This is what it says.

original: stong nyid spros pa dang bral ba las gang la gang gis 'dul ba'i gzugs sna tshogs par ston pa ni sprul pa gsum pa ste /
analyzed: stong nyid spros pa dang bral ba las gang la gang gis 'dul ba'i gzugs sna tshogs par ston pa ni sprul pa gsum pa ste /
translated: The third emanation is the display of various forms to tame whomever by whatever means from the emptiness free of elaborations.

original: gong du ston pa'i stong pa nyid ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag po dang / dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin mchog / ces bya la /
analyzed: gong du ston pa'i stong pa nyid ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag po dang / dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin mchog / ces bya la /
translated: The emptiness taught above is the lord of all buddhas of the three times and is called “the supreme nature of all things.”

original: de ltar bstan pa'i sgo nas khams gsum pa rnams kyi yid dga' bar byed pa dang / phyin ci log gi rab rib bsal ba dang / rten dang brten pa'i gzugs dngos @251a * //
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa'i sgo nas khams gsum pa rnams kyi yid dga' bar byed pa dang / phyin ci log gi rab rib bsal ba dang / rten dang brten pa'i gzugs dngos @251a * //
translated: By teaching in that way, the minds of those in the three realms are delighted, the cataracts of error are removed, and the various forms of the support and supported are generated.

original: po sna tshogs bskyed pas ni sprul pa gsum pa ste /
analyzed: po sna tshogs bskyed pas ni sprul pa gsum pa ste /
translated: The third emanation is the display of various forms to tame whomever by whatever means from the emptiness free of elaborations.🔽The verse continues:

original: 'gro kun dga' ba'i mig dang ldan //
analyzed: 'gro kun dga' ba'i mig dang ldan //
translated: Endowed with eyes that delight all beings,

original: sna tshogs gzugs can skyed pa po //
analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs can skyed pa po //
translated: the creator of various forms.

original: zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: The verse continues:

original: mchod cing rjed pa drang srong che //
analyzed: mchod cing rjed pa drang srong che //
translated: The great sage is worshipped and revered.

original: zhes pa ni rdzu 'phrul dang mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa ni drang srong chen po yin la /
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdzu 'phrul dang mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa ni drang srong chen po yin la /
translated: One who possesses miracles and higher perceptions is a great sage.

original: bsnyen bkur dang mchod pa la sogs pa'i gnas su gyur pas kun gyi bstod pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya zhing /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur dang mchod pa la sogs pa'i gnas su gyur pas kun gyi bstod pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya zhing /
translated: Since he is the object of service, worship, and so forth, he is praised by all.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi mtshan nyid du nges pas theg pa chen po la sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi mtshan nyid du nges pas theg pa chen po la sbyor ba ni /
translated: Since he is ascertained to be the characteristic of body, speech, and mind, he is the one who connects to the Mahayana.

original: rigs gsum 'chang ba gsang sngags 'chang //
analyzed: rigs gsum 'chang ba gsang sngags 'chang //
translated: He is the holder of the three families, the holder of secret mantra.

original: zhes bya'o // de nyid stong gsum thams cad mnyam par 'gro zhing sems can rnams kyi yid skyob par mdzad pas ni /🔽dam tshig chen po gsang sngags 'dzin //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de nyid stong gsum thams cad mnyam par 'gro zhing sems can rnams kyi yid skyob par mdzad pas ni / dam tshig chen po gsang sngags 'dzin //
translated: Since he is the one who goes to all three thousand worlds and protects the minds of sentient beings, he is

original: zhes bya la /
analyzed: zhes bya la /
translated: the holder of the great pledge, the holder of secret mantra.

original: rten khyad par can gyi mtshan nyid sangs rgyas dang chos dang / dge 'dun dag pa nyid ston pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa'i theg pa chen po rnams mchog tu gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: rten khyad par can gyi mtshan nyid sangs rgyas dang chos dang / dge 'dun dag pa nyid ston pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa'i theg pa chen po rnams mchog tu gyur pa yin la /
translated: The characteristics of the special support are the purities of the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha, the bodhisattvas, the tathagatas, and the vajra holders, which are the supreme Mahayana.

original: snying rje chen po dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba chen po ston pa ni /
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba chen po ston pa ni /
translated: The teaching of great compassion, the emptiness of all phenomena, and unchanging great bliss

original: gtso bo dkon mchog gsum 'dzin pa //
analyzed: gtso bo dkon mchog gsum 'dzin pa //
translated: is the principal one who upholds the Three Jewels.

original: theg pa mchog gsum ston pa po //
analyzed: theg pa mchog gsum ston pa po //
translated: He is the teacher of the three supreme vehicles.

original: zhes bya'o // de lta bu'i theg pa chen po de rnams kyi byang chub chen po'i don yod cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing khams su 'dzin par mdzad cing ngan 'gro rnam par rgyal ba dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i go 'phang la gnas par byed pas na /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de lta bu'i theg pa chen po de rnams kyi byang chub chen po'i don yod cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing khams su 'dzin par mdzad cing ngan 'gro rnam par rgyal ba dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i go 'phang la gnas par byed pas na /
translated: Thus, since that Great Vehicle exists for the purpose of the great enlightenment of those who uphold the buddhafields, and since it causes one to abide in the state of total victory over the lower realms and the great vajra holder,

original: don yod zhags pa rnam par rgyal //
analyzed: don yod zhags pa rnam par rgyal //
translated: he is Amoghâñjali, the Victorious One.

original: 'dzin pa chen po rdo rje'i zhags //
analyzed: 'dzin pa chen po rdo rje'i zhags //
translated: He is the great holder, the vajra hook.

original: zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: Thus, he is called Amoghâñjali.

original: de ltar chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes spros pa dang bral ba 'gro ba rnams kyi rgyud la 'gugs par mdzad pa dang / de nyid brtan pa chen po'i tshul gyis mi 'gyur bar mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes spros pa dang bral ba 'gro ba rnams kyi rgyud la 'gugs par mdzad pa dang / de nyid brtan pa chen po'i tshul gyis mi 'gyur bar mdzad pa ni /
translated: Thus, since the wisdom of the dharmadhatu, free from proliferation, attracts the mindstreams of migrating beings, and since that very [wisdom] is made unchanging through the method of the great stability,

original: rdo rje lcags kyu zhags pa che //
analyzed: rdo rje lcags kyu zhags pa che //
translated: The great vajra hook and noose.

original: zhes bya'o // rgyu nges pa'i mtshan nyid las chos kyi dbyings nges par mthong ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes bya la /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // rgyu nges pa'i mtshan nyid las chos kyi dbyings nges par mthong ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes bya la /
translated: From the characteristic of ascertaining the cause, seeing the ascertained dharmadhātu is called the gnosis of the dharmadhātu.

original: nges pa'i tshul gyi bshad pa ste gnyis so //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshul gyi bshad pa ste gnyis so //
translated: This is the second explanation of the mode of ascertainment.

original: sems can rnams ngo bo nyid kyi stong pa ni chos kyi dbyings yin la /
analyzed: sems can rnams ngo bo nyid kyi stong pa ni chos kyi dbyings yin la /
translated: The emptiness of the nature of sentient beings is the dharmadhātu.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa las me long lta bu'i ye shes te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa las me long lta bu'i ye shes te /
translated: From the complete purification of the all-base consciousness, there is mirrorlike gnosis.

original: de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa @251b rnams kyi thugs te /
analyzed: de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa @251b rnams kyi thugs te /
translated: That itself is the mind of the tathāgatas.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa mi bskyod pa zhe sdang chen po'i bdag nyid gdug pa rnams rjes su gzung ba'i tshul gyis 'jigs byed chen po'i skur bstan te /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa mi bskyod pa zhe sdang chen po'i bdag nyid gdug pa rnams rjes su gzung ba'i tshul gyis 'jigs byed chen po'i skur bstan te /
translated: That is the tathāgata Akṣobhya, who, in the manner of accepting the fierce ones, appears in the form of Mahābhairava.

original: rdo rje 'jigs byed 'jigs par byed //
analyzed: rdo rje 'jigs byed 'jigs par byed //
translated: The vajra bhairava is terrifying.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: And so forth.

original: khams gsum pa 'jigs par byed pa drag po dang / dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa rnams 'jigs par mdzad pa nyid kyis na de skad ces bya la /🔽de sprul pa'i khro bo la sogs pa'i rgyal por zhugs pa dang / gzugs dang tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ye shes kyi dbang po rnams dag pa las /
analyzed: khams gsum pa 'jigs par byed pa drag po dang / dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa rnams 'jigs par mdzad pa nyid kyis na de skad ces bya la / de sprul pa'i khro bo la sogs pa'i rgyal por zhugs pa dang / gzugs dang tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ye shes kyi dbang po rnams dag pa las /
translated: The terrifying of the three realms is Rudra, Mahesvara, and so on, and they are terrified by the wrathful emanations and so on.

original: rigs drug gi bdag nyid rnam par snang mdzad dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag tu med pa dang / don yod grub pa dang / mi bskyod pa dang / rdo rje sems dpa' rnams su bstan te /
analyzed: rigs drug gi bdag nyid rnam par snang mdzad dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag tu med pa dang / don yod grub pa dang / mi bskyod pa dang / rdo rje sems dpa' rnams su bstan te /
translated: The kings are the six families, which are taught to be Vairochana, Ratnasambhava, Amitabha, Amoghasiddhi, Akshobhya, and Vajrasattva, who are the purities of the faculties of form, feeling, perception, formation, consciousness, and gnosis.

original: khro bo'i rgyal po gdong drug 'jigs //
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po gdong drug 'jigs //
translated: The wrathful king with six faces is terrifying.

original: mig drug lag drug stobs dang ldan //
analyzed: mig drug lag drug stobs dang ldan //
translated: He has six eyes and six arms and is powerful.

original: zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs de rnams rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i tshul gyis gdug pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid la zhal mche ba rab tu gtsigs pas na /🔽keng rus mche ba gtsigs pa po //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs de rnams rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i tshul gyis gdug pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid la zhal mche ba rab tu gtsigs pas na / keng rus mche ba gtsigs pa po //
translated: Those Tathagata families, by way of being free from conceptuality, are the nature of the fierce ones, since they are the ones who bare their fangs at the characteristics of the fierce ones.

original: zhes bya la /
analyzed: zhes bya la /
translated: Thus, it is called “the skeleton with bared fangs.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku re re la yang sems bskyed pa nas 'gro ba 'dul ba'i las mdzad pa'i bar du rigs lnga dang / rigs re re la yang sems bskyed pa nas phrin las kyi bar du bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku re re la yang sems bskyed pa nas 'gro ba 'dul ba'i las mdzad pa'i bar du rigs lnga dang / rigs re re la yang sems bskyed pa nas phrin las kyi bar du bstan pa ni /
translated: Also, in each of the Tathagata bodies, from the arousing of the mind up to the performance of the activity of taming migrators, there are the five families, and in each of the families, from the arousing of the mind up to the activity, there are the five families.

original: rigs brgya rtsa brgyad nyi shu rtsa lnga ste /🔽des na / ha la ha la gdong brgya pa //
analyzed: rigs brgya rtsa brgyad nyi shu rtsa lnga ste / des na / ha la ha la gdong brgya pa //
translated: Thus, there are one hundred and eight families, twenty-five families,

original: zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: and therefore, it is called “the one with one hundred faces of the hala hala.”

original: sprul pa'i tshogs de dag gis 'gro ba rnams kyi gshin rje gsod par mdzad la /
analyzed: sprul pa'i tshogs de dag gis 'gro ba rnams kyi gshin rje gsod par mdzad la /

analyzed: gang rgyangs ha ha nges par sgrogs //

original: zhes pa ni zhal drug po rab tu bzhad pa ha ha zhes sgrogs pa nyid dang / gtum po chen po'i rta skad kyis stong gsum thams cad du khyab pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa ni zhal drug po rab tu bzhad pa ha ha zhes sgrogs pa nyid dang / gtum po chen po'i rta skad kyis stong gsum thams cad du khyab pa nyid do //
translated: The six faces are laughing, proclaiming “ha ha,” and the neighing of the great Caṇḍa pervades the entire trichiliocosm.

original: yi ge drug pa rdo rje'i sgra //
analyzed: yi ge drug pa rdo rje'i sgra //
translated: The six syllables are the sound of the vajra.

original: zhes pa ni dbyangs dang gsal byed 'dus @253b pa'i mtshan nyid aa au ri li zhes pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dbyangs dang gsal byed 'dus @253b pa'i mtshan nyid aa au ri li zhes pa nyid do //
translated: The six syllables are the characteristics of the combination of vowels and consonants, namely, a, ā, ri, and li.

original: de la aa ni stong nyid kyi ye shes kyi khams dang nam mkha'i khams gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la aa ni stong nyid kyi ye shes kyi khams dang nam mkha'i khams gcig pa nyid do //
translated: In this regard, a is the unity of the element of the gnosis of emptiness and the element of space.

original: yam 'du byed rlung gi khams dang / ra tshor ba me'i khams dang / au 'du shes chu'i khams dang / lam gzugs sa'i khams rnams ni /
analyzed: yam 'du byed rlung gi khams dang / ra tshor ba me'i khams dang / au 'du shes chu'i khams dang / lam gzugs sa'i khams rnams ni /
translated: Ya is the formation element of wind, ra is the feeling element of fire, ā is the discernment element of water, and la is the form element of earth.

original: phung po drug dang / 'byung ba drug dang / dbang po drug dang / yul drug dang / lus kyi bya ba dbang po drug dang / ro drug dang ma dag pa'i gnas skabs drug pa ni rtog pa med pa'i mtshan nyid las byung ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya zhing /
analyzed: phung po drug dang / 'byung ba drug dang / dbang po drug dang / yul drug dang / lus kyi bya ba dbang po drug dang / ro drug dang ma dag pa'i gnas skabs drug pa ni rtog pa med pa'i mtshan nyid las byung ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya zhing /
translated: The six aggregates, six elements, six sense faculties, six objects, six bodily actions, six sense faculties, six tastes, and six impure states are called that which arises from the characteristic of nonconceptuality.

original: de nyid stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo spros pa'i tshig chen por gyur pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo spros pa'i tshig chen por gyur pa ni /
translated: That itself is the essence of emptiness, which arises as the great🔽word of proliferation.

original: 'jam dbyangs chen po sgra che ba //
analyzed: 'jam dbyangs chen po sgra che ba //
translated: It is called “the great Mañjughoṣa, the great sound.”🔽Since those are established as things produced by conditions, like🔽the world, they are the same in emptiness, unborn.

original: zhes bya'o // de dag nyid sgra brjod pa bzhin du 'jig rten pa dang mtshungs par rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i dngos por grub pa nyid nas khams gsum thams cad stong pa nyid du gcig pa skye ba med pa aas bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de dag nyid sgra brjod pa bzhin du 'jig rten pa dang mtshungs par rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i dngos por grub pa nyid nas khams gsum thams cad stong pa nyid du gcig pa skye ba med pa aas bstan pa ni /
translated: A is the teaching of the nonarising of all three worlds.

original: 'jig rten gsum na sgra gcig pa //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum na sgra gcig pa //
translated: It is the single sound in the three worlds.

original: zhes bya la de nyid nam mkha'i khams thams cad du brjod pa bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i tshul gyis khyab pa gang yin pa de la /🔽nam mkha'i mtha' klas sgra sgrogs pa //
analyzed: zhes bya la de nyid nam mkha'i khams thams cad du brjod pa bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i tshul gyis khyab pa gang yin pa de la / nam mkha'i mtha' klas sgra sgrogs pa //
translated: Just as space pervades all realms, it pervades all worlds in the same way.

original: zhes pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa nyid do //
translated: It is the sound that resounds to the limits of space.🔽It is the supreme of all sounds.

original: sgra dang ldan pa rnams kyi mchog / ces bya ba nyid ni 'jam dpal zhes bya ba 'di nyid ni des par 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: sgra dang ldan pa rnams kyi mchog / ces bya ba nyid ni 'jam dpal zhes bya ba 'di nyid ni des par 'byung ba yin te /
translated: This very Mañjuśrī is the definitive emergence.

original: de ltar stong pa nyid sgra'i don dang ldan zhing dngos po kun gyi mchog tu gyur pa de la de skad ces bya zhing /
analyzed: de ltar stong pa nyid sgra'i don dang ldan zhing dngos po kun gyi mchog tu gyur pa de la de skad ces bya zhing /
translated: Thus, it is called that because it is endowed with the meaning of the word emptiness and is supreme among all things.

original: de nyid me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nges pa lnga'i tshul du bshad pa ste gsum pa'o /
analyzed: de nyid me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nges pa lnga'i tshul du bshad pa ste gsum pa'o /
translated: That is the explanation of the nature of mirror-like wisdom in the manner of the five certainties.

original: // / de ltar gyi ye shes dang sku dang thugs yongs su grub pa las gsung nges par 'byung ba las ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa las /
analyzed: // / de ltar gyi ye shes dang sku dang thugs yongs su grub pa las gsung nges par 'byung ba las ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa las /
translated: From the definitive emergence of speech, which is the perfect accomplishment of wisdom, body, and mind, the mental consciousness is totally purified.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi so sor rtog pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi so sor rtog pa'i ye shes te /
translated: It is the individually discriminating wisdom of the tathāgatas.

original: de'i tshul du bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de'i tshul du bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of this method is as follows.

original: yang dag bdag med de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: yang dag bdag med de bzhin nyid //
translated: The pure selflessness, suchness,

original: ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so on.

original: de la gsung yongs su dag pa'i nyin mtshan ni mu stegs la sogs pas brtags pa'i bdag dang byed pa po dang bral zhing yang dag pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la gsung yongs su dag pa'i nyin mtshan ni mu stegs la sogs pas brtags pa'i bdag dang byed pa po dang bral zhing yang dag pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid do zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, the day and night of the pure speech are the selflessness which is free from the self and agent imagined by the tīrthikas, and is the nature of the pure suchness.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' de nyid yi ge'i gzugs kyis brjod pa gang yin pa de la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' de nyid yi ge'i gzugs kyis brjod pa gang yin pa de la /
translated: That which is expressed by the form of letters in that very limit of reality

original: yang dag mtha' ste yi ge med //
analyzed: yang dag mtha' ste yi ge med //
translated: is called the limit of reality, which is without letters.

original: ces bya zhing de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid du ston pa ste nyan thos la sogs pa'i rtog pa'i nang @254a * //🔽nas khyu'i rgyal por zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: ces bya zhing de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid du ston pa ste nyan thos la sogs pa'i rtog pa'i nang @254a * // nas khyu'i rgyal por zhugs pa ni /
translated: And the speech of the Tathāgata teaches that all phenomena are emptiness, and is the king of herds among the concepts of śrāvakas and so on.🔽It is said:

original: stong nyid smra ba'i khyu mchog ste //
analyzed: stong nyid smra ba'i khyu mchog ste //
translated: The emptiness-proclaiming king of herds.

original: zhes bya'o // zab cing rgya che'i sgra sgrogs pa //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // zab cing rgya che'i sgra sgrogs pa //
translated: The proclamation of the sound of the profound and vast

original: zhes pa ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang lhan cig pa thabs dang shes rab chags pa'i tshul dang / khro bo chen po'i rang bzhin du stong pa ni zab pa yin la /
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang lhan cig pa thabs dang shes rab chags pa'i tshul dang / khro bo chen po'i rang bzhin du stong pa ni zab pa yin la /
translated: This is the profound, in the manner of the method and wisdom of passion, of the simultaneous passion and hatred.

original: de nyid khams gsum pa'i sems can thams cad yongs su bzung ba'i tshul gyis nges par grags pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid khams gsum pa'i sems can thams cad yongs su bzung ba'i tshul gyis nges par grags pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That very thing is the fame of the one who is definitely renowned in the manner of the embrace of all sentient beings of the three realms.

original: de nyid theg pa chen po 'ba' zhig gis don mdzad dam /
analyzed: de nyid theg pa chen po 'ba' zhig gis don mdzad dam /
translated: Does he accomplish the aims of only the Great Vehicle?

original: de lta na ni nyan thos la sogs pa rjes su mi 'dzin pa'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na ni nyan thos la sogs pa rjes su mi 'dzin pa'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, it would follow that he is a perfect buddha who does not take śrāvakas and so on into his following.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /🔽chos kyi dung ste sgra chen ldan //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa / chos kyi dung ste sgra chen ldan //
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽The Dharma conch, the great sound,

original: chos kyi gand'i sgra bo che //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: chos kyi gand'i sgra bo che // zhes gsungs te /
translated: The great sound of the Dharma drum.

original: de la chos ni mngon par mtho ba thag ring por rab tu bsgrags pa nyid du ste /
analyzed: de la chos ni mngon par mtho ba thag ring por rab tu bsgrags pa nyid du ste /
translated: There, the Dharma is the far-reaching exalted Dharma.

original: dpe'i tshul gyis sems can thams cad rjes su 'dzin pa nyid do //
analyzed: dpe'i tshul gyis sems can thams cad rjes su 'dzin pa nyid do //
translated: He is the holder of all sentient beings, because he is the protector of all sentient beings in the manner of a universal monarch.

original: dge 'dun de ni so so skye bo gzhan la med cing dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu bar mdzad pa nyid do //
analyzed: dge 'dun de ni so so skye bo gzhan la med cing dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu bar mdzad pa nyid do //
translated: He is the holder of the Saṅgha, because he is the protector of the Saṅgha of the noble listeners.🔽He is the holder of all sentient beings, because he is the protector of all sentient beings in the manner of a universal monarch.

original: de yang 'di'i tshul gyis 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyang rjes su 'dzin par mdzad do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de yang 'di'i tshul gyis 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyang rjes su 'dzin par mdzad do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: He is the holder of the Saṅgha, because he is the protector of the Saṅgha of the noble listeners.🔽He is the holder of all sentient beings, because he is the protector of all sentient beings in the manner of a universal monarch.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni phung po lhag ma med par mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin pas na /🔽mi gnas mya ngan 'das pa po //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni phung po lhag ma med par mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin pas na / mi gnas mya ngan 'das pa po //
translated: He is the holder of the Saṅgha, because he is the protector of the Saṅgha of the noble listeners.🔽He is the holder of all sentient beings, because he is the protector of all sentient beings in the manner of a universal monarch.🔽He is the holder of the Saṅgha, because he is the protector of the Saṅgha of the noble listeners.🔽He is the holder of all sentient beings, because he is the protector of all sentient beings in the manner of a universal monarch.🔽He is the holder of the Saṅgha, because he is the protector of the Saṅgha of the noble listeners.🔽He is the holder of all sentient beings, because he is the protector of all sentient beings in the manner of a universal monarch.

original: zhes bya'o // 'o na de bzhin gshegs pa ni theg pa chen po'i rigs can du nyan thos kyi rigs can tsam zhig la chos ston nam zhen ma yin par gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // 'o na de bzhin gshegs pa ni theg pa chen po'i rigs can du nyan thos kyi rigs can tsam zhig la chos ston nam zhen ma yin par gsungs pa ni /
translated: He is the holder of the Saṅgha, because he is the protector of the Saṅgha of the noble listeners.

original: phyogs bcu'i chos kyi rnga bo che //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i chos kyi rnga bo che //
translated: He is the holder of all sentient beings, because he is the protector of all sentient beings in the manner of a universal monarch.🔽He is the holder of the Saṅgha, because he is the protector of the Saṅgha of the noble listeners.🔽He is the holder of all sentient beings, because he is the protector of all sentient beings in the manner of a universal monarch.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: He is the holder of the Sa

original: phyogs bcu ni ma lus pa'i don yin la rnga ni de dag thams cad la rab tu bsgrags pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs bcu ni ma lus pa'i don yin la rnga ni de dag thams cad la rab tu bsgrags pa ste /
translated: The ten directions are the totality of objects, and the drum is the proclamation of all of them.

original: rigs ma nges pa dag kyang rjes su 'dzin pa nyid do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: rigs ma nges pa dag kyang rjes su 'dzin pa nyid do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intention is that even those of unfixed potential are taken care of.

original: gzugs med gzugs bzang dam pa ste //
analyzed: gzugs med gzugs bzang dam pa ste //
translated: The formless is the excellent, supreme form.

original: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung yongs su rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung yongs su rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: This is the perfection of the speech of the Tathagata.

original: de 'dus byas pa'i gzugs su med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku phun sum tshogs pa'i bdag nyid du sgrub pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de 'dus byas pa'i gzugs su med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku phun sum tshogs pa'i bdag nyid du sgrub pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is called that because it establishes the perfection of the Buddha body, which is not a form that is compounded.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i chos kyi skur grub la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i chos kyi skur grub la /
translated: It is established as the Dharma body, free from conceptual thought.

original: sbrul pa'i skus 'gro ba drug gi rigs kyi gtso bor gyur pa dang / rkyen gyi rjes su 'dul ba'i gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs rnams skyob pa chen po'i sku las byung ba ni /
analyzed: sbrul pa'i skus 'gro ba drug gi rigs kyi gtso bor gyur pa dang / rkyen gyi rjes su 'dul ba'i gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs rnams skyob pa chen po'i sku las byung ba ni /
translated: The emanation body, which is the chief of the six classes of migrating beings, and the various forms that are disciplined in accordance with conditions, arise from the body of the great protector.

original: sna tshogs gzugs can las skyes //
analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs can las skyes //
translated: It arises from the one with various forms.

original: zhes bya'o // gzugs kyi sku dang po me long g-ya' dag pa'i rang bzhin @254b gyi gzugs brnyan rnam pa sna tshogs par snang zhing /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // gzugs kyi sku dang po me long g-ya' dag pa'i rang bzhin @254b gyi gzugs brnyan rnam pa sna tshogs par snang zhing /
translated: The first form body is like a mirror, in which various reflections appear, the nature of which is a pure mirror.

original: de las dri ma dag smra brjod la sogs pa nyid kyis sel ba ltar /
analyzed: de las dri ma dag smra brjod la sogs pa nyid kyis sel ba ltar /
translated: And just as the stains are removed by speaking and so on,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes bya'i sgrib pa ma lus pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la snang zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes bya'i sgrib pa ma lus pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la snang zhing /
translated: so too all the bodhisattvas’ obscurations to omniscience appear in the body of the Tathāgata.

original: de'i chos de'i ting nge 'dzin gyis grangs med par gyur par mdzad /
analyzed: de'i chos de'i ting nge 'dzin gyis grangs med par gyur par mdzad /
translated: And through the Dharma of that body, they are made to be countless through concentration.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams rang nyid kyi sgrib pa rnam par sel bar mdzad pa ni /🔽gzugs rnams thams cad snang ba'i dpal //🔽zhes bya'o // de nyid me long gi dkyil 'khor ltar gzugs brnyan thams cad snang bar mdzad pas na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams rang nyid kyi sgrib pa rnam par sel bar mdzad pa ni / gzugs rnams thams cad snang ba'i dpal // zhes bya'o // de nyid me long gi dkyil 'khor ltar gzugs brnyan thams cad snang bar mdzad pas na /
translated: The bodhisattvas’ own obscurations are removed.🔽It is glorious in the appearance of all forms.🔽Just as a mirror’s surface is glorious in the appearance of all reflections,

original: gzugs brnyan ma lus 'chang ba po //🔽zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan ma lus 'chang ba po //🔽zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: it is the bearer of all reflections.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyis gsungs pa'i chos dam pa de la phyi rol gyi rnam par g-yeng ba rnams kyi tshugs pa med pa dang / tshangs pa dang khyab 'jug la sogs pa'i bstan pa bas khyad par du gyur cing khams gsum pa thams cad kyi bdag por gyur pas na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyis gsungs pa'i chos dam pa de la phyi rol gyi rnam par g-yeng ba rnams kyi tshugs pa med pa dang / tshangs pa dang khyab 'jug la sogs pa'i bstan pa bas khyad par du gyur cing khams gsum pa thams cad kyi bdag por gyur pas na /
translated: That excellent Dharma taught by all the Buddhas is not overcome by external distractions, and is superior to the teachings of Brahma, Vishnu, and so forth, and is the lord of all three realms.

original: tshugs pa med cing che bar grags //
analyzed: tshugs pa med cing che bar grags //
translated: It is said to be “unovercome and renowned as great.”

original: khams gsum dbang phyug chen po ste //
analyzed: khams gsum dbang phyug chen po ste //
translated: It is the great lord of the three realms.

original: zhes bya zhing de nyid 'phags pa rnams kyi nges pa'i la ma du gyur pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa la gnas par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya zhing de nyid 'phags pa rnams kyi nges pa'i la ma du gyur pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa la gnas par gyur pa ni /
translated: And that itself becomes the definite path of the noble ones, and when one becomes established on the bodhisattva stages,

original: 'phags lam shin tu mtho la gnas //
analyzed: 'phags lam shin tu mtho la gnas //
translated: it is said to be “established on the very high path of the noble ones.”

original: zhes bya'o // de ltar gsung yongs su dag pa las grub pa'i yon tan bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de ltar gsung yongs su dag pa las grub pa'i yon tan bstan pa ni /
translated: Thus, the qualities that are accomplished from the completely pure speech are taught:🔽The great spread of the Dharma’s crest jewel,

original: dar ba chen po chos kyi tog / zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dar ba chen po chos kyi tog / zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so forth.

original: gnyis su med pa'i bde ba'i ye shes chen po dang rgyun gyi ye shes chen po thob par gyur pa de ni ba dan chen po ltar rdzu 'phrul dang / mngon par shes pas nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang / khams gsum gnas kyi gong na de las med pa'i gtsug gi nor bu ltar mtho ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i bde ba'i ye shes chen po dang rgyun gyi ye shes chen po thob par gyur pa de ni ba dan chen po ltar rdzu 'phrul dang / mngon par shes pas nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang / khams gsum gnas kyi gong na de las med pa'i gtsug gi nor bu ltar mtho ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He has attained the great pristine awareness of great bliss that is nondual and the great pristine awareness of continuity. He is like a great banner, for he moves through space by means of his magical powers and higher perceptions. He is like a crest jewel, for he is higher than the highest in the three realms.

original: 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bcud kyis len yongs su grub pa'i nyi ma dang / zla ba ji srid gnas kyi bar du khams gsum na lo bcu drug pa 'dra ba'i cha byad du 'dug pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bcud kyis len yongs su grub pa'i nyi ma dang / zla ba ji srid gnas kyi bar du khams gsum na lo bcu drug pa 'dra ba'i cha byad du 'dug pa ni /
translated: He is like the sun and moon of the elixir of the ten worldly powers, for he remains in the three realms for as long as the sun and moon endure, in a form like that of a sixteen-year-old.

original: 'jig rten gsum na gzhon lus gcig / ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum na gzhon lus gcig / ces bya'o //
translated: He is the sole youthful body in the three worlds.

original: des so so'i skye bo tha ma pa'i tshe rabs dpag tu med par gnas shing skye dgu rnams kyi gtso bor gyur pa ni /
analyzed: des so so'i skye bo tha ma pa'i tshe rabs dpag tu med par gnas shing skye dgu rnams kyi gtso bor gyur pa ni /
translated: He remains for countless lifetimes as an ordinary being and becomes the chief of all beings.

original: gnas brtan rgan po skye dgu'i ba dag / ces bya'o //
analyzed: gnas brtan rgan po skye dgu'i ba dag / ces bya'o //
translated: He is the elder, the old man, the chief of all beings.

original: de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan dang dpe byad ltar 'od gang ba dang / yan lag dang nying lag mdzes @255a * //
analyzed: de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan dang dpe byad ltar 'od gang ba dang / yan lag dang nying lag mdzes @255a * //
translated: It is radiant like the major and minor marks of the tathagatas, and its limbs and digits are beautiful.🔽

original: shing rgyas par gyur pa de la /
analyzed: shing rgyas par gyur pa de la /
translated: That is like the major and minor marks of the Tathagata, which are filled with light, and the limbs and minor limbs are beautiful and expansive.

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis mtshan 'chang ba //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis mtshan 'chang ba //
translated: That is called “bearing the thirty-two marks.”

original: zhes bya zhing de nyid khams gsum pa thams cad kyi bu gcig pa ltar yid du 'ong zhing thig le mchog la sogs pa 'gugs par mdzad pa ni /🔽sdu gu 'jig rten gsum na mdzes //
analyzed: zhes bya zhing de nyid khams gsum pa thams cad kyi bu gcig pa ltar yid du 'ong zhing thig le mchog la sogs pa 'gugs par mdzad pa ni / sdu gu 'jig rten gsum na mdzes //
translated: That is like the only son of all the three realms, who is attractive and who attracts the supreme bindu, and so on.

original: zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: That is called “beautiful in the three worlds.”🔽When the abode of such a great being is applied, it abides in the world as long as the sun and moon exist.

original: de lta bu'i bdag nyid chen po'i gnas sbyor ba des nyi ma dang / zla ba gnas kyi bar du 'jig rten du gnas na theg pa chen po'i sems can thams cad grol bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bu'i bdag nyid chen po'i gnas sbyor ba des nyi ma dang / zla ba gnas kyi bar du 'jig rten du gnas na theg pa chen po'i sems can thams cad grol bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to liberate all sentient beings of the Mahayana,

original: theg pa chen po'i zab mo'i don ston cing phyi dang nang gi nad dang / 'jigs pa thams cad dang sdug bsngal sna tshogs dang bral bar gyur pa ni /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i zab mo'i don ston cing phyi dang nang gi nad dang / 'jigs pa thams cad dang sdug bsngal sna tshogs dang bral bar gyur pa ni /
translated: the profound meaning of the Mahayana is taught, and one is free from all outer and inner illnesses, fears, and various sufferings.

original: 'jig rten shes legs slob dpon te //
analyzed: 'jig rten shes legs slob dpon te //
translated: The master of the world is the good teacher.

original: 'jig rten slob dpon 'jigs pa med //
analyzed: 'jig rten slob dpon 'jigs pa med //
translated: The master of the world is fearless.

original: ces bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: ces bya ba nyid do //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: de lta bu'i rdo rje slob dpon de 'gro ba mtha' dag gi mgon du gyur cing /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rdo rje slob dpon de 'gro ba mtha' dag gi mgon du gyur cing /
translated: Such a vajra master becomes the protector of all beings.

original: thugs rje chen po dang ldan pas sems can rnams la thugs brtse bar mdzad pas ni /
analyzed: thugs rje chen po dang ldan pas sems can rnams la thugs brtse bar mdzad pas ni /
translated: And because he is compassionate to sentient beings through his great compassion,

original: mgon skyob 'jig rten yid gcugs pa //🔽zhes bya zhing skyabs thams cad kyi gtso bor gyur pas bla na med pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: mgon skyob 'jig rten yid gcugs pa // zhes bya zhing skyabs thams cad kyi gtso bor gyur pas bla na med pa nyid kyis na /
translated: he is the protector, the refuge, the friend of the world.🔽And because he is the foremost of all refuges, he is unsurpassed,

original: skyabs dang skyob pa bla na med //🔽ces bya'o // de ltar 'jig rten ba'i dngos grub smon par bstan nas /
analyzed: skyabs dang skyob pa bla na med // ces bya'o // de ltar 'jig rten ba'i dngos grub smon par bstan nas /
translated: so he is the unsurpassed refuge and protector.🔽Having thus taught the mundane accomplishments,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub bstan pa ni /
translated: the supramundane accomplishments are taught:

original: nam mkha'i khams la longs spyod pa //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams la longs spyod pa //
translated: Enjoyment in the realm of space,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so forth.

original: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ni nam mkha'i mtha' dang mnyam par 'gro ba'i don la mngon par spyod pa la de skad ces bya la /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ni nam mkha'i mtha' dang mnyam par 'gro ba'i don la mngon par spyod pa la de skad ces bya la /
translated: The spiritual attainment of the great seal is so called because it is the direct experience of the benefit of beings equal to the limits of space.

original: de nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes nyid de /
analyzed: de nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes nyid de /
translated: That itself is the very intuition of the knowledge of all things.

original: de yang ye shes rnam pa sna tshogs pa zad pa med pa'i rgya mtshor gyur pa ni /
analyzed: de yang ye shes rnam pa sna tshogs pa zad pa med pa'i rgya mtshor gyur pa ni /
translated: Moreover, the ocean of inexhaustible varieties of intuition

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mtsho //🔽zhes pa nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mtsho // zhes pa nyid do //
translated: is the ocean of the intuition of all things.

original: de ltar ye shes spros pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyang 'gro ba rnams yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma rig pa'i sbubs kyis g-yogs pa thams cad dang shes rab kyi bde ba chen pos 'byed pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de ltar ye shes spros pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyang 'gro ba rnams yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma rig pa'i sbubs kyis g-yogs pa thams cad dang shes rab kyi bde ba chen pos 'byed pa'i phyir na /
translated: Thus, the characteristic of intuition free from conceptual elaboration is called the “opener of the egg of ignorance” because it opens the mental consciousness of all beings covered by the shell of ignorance with the great bliss of wisdom.

original: ma rig pa'i sbubs 'byed pa zhes bya zhing de nyid srid pa'i dra ba nyid do //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i sbubs 'byed pa zhes bya zhing de nyid srid pa'i dra ba nyid do //
translated: That itself is the “net of existence.”

original: de rab tu 'joms pa gang yin pa de la /
analyzed: de rab tu 'joms pa gang yin pa de la /
translated: That which completely destroys it

original: srid pa'i dra ba 'joms pa po //
analyzed: srid pa'i dra ba 'joms pa po //
translated: is called the “destroyer of the net of existence.”

original: zhes bya'o // de lta bu'i srid pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis yang nas yang du 'byung ba'i sdug bsngal ba ni nyon mongs pa yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de lta bu'i srid pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis yang nas yang du 'byung ba'i sdug bsngal ba ni nyon mongs pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the suffering that arises again and again through the conditions of the desire for existence and so on is the afflictions.

original: de lta bu'i ye shes kyi chu bos zhi bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: de lta bu'i ye shes kyi chu bos zhi bar byed pa ni /
translated: The river of wisdom pacifies that.

original: nyon mongs ma lus zhi byed pa //
analyzed: nyon mongs ma lus zhi byed pa //
translated: Pacifying all afflictions

original: zhes bya @255b zhing de la dus kyi ye shes chen po dang ldan pas rtag par bsgrubs shing de yongs su rdzogs pa'i mthar rgyun gyi ye shes 'bras bu chen po ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa
analyzed: zhes bya @255b zhing de la dus kyi ye shes chen po dang ldan pas rtag par bsgrubs shing de yongs su rdzogs pa'i mthar rgyun gyi ye shes 'bras bu chen po ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa
translated: Since it is endowed with the great wisdom of time, it is always accomplished. At the conclusion of the perfection of that, the great result of the river of wisdom is the Bhagavān Buddha, who has gone to the other side of the ocean of saṃsāra.

original: de ni / 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho'i pha rol phyin //
analyzed: de ni / 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho'i pha rol phyin //
translated: He is the one who has gone to the other side of the ocean of saṃsāra.

original: zhes bya'o // de lta bu'i srid pa'i dra ba 'joms pa 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las brgal ba de ga las thob ce na /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de lta bu'i srid pa'i dra ba 'joms pa 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las brgal ba de ga las thob ce na /
translated: From where is that attainment of the destruction of the net of existence, the crossing of the ocean of saṃsāra, obtained?

original: ye shes dbang bskur cod pan can //
analyzed: ye shes dbang bskur cod pan can //
translated: The one who is crowned with the empowerment of wisdom

original: zhe bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhe bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so on.

original: ye shes kyis dbang bskur ba ni /
analyzed: ye shes kyis dbang bskur ba ni /
translated: The empowerment conferred by pristine consciousness is as follows:

original: ye shes dbang bskur cod pan can //
analyzed: ye shes dbang bskur cod pan can //
translated: The empowerment of pristine consciousness, crowned.

original: zhes bya'o // bde ba chen po'i mtshan nyid du gnas pas bdag gi bag chags kyi dri ma thams cad dag par gyur pa nyid dang / bde ba chen po de nyid rdo rje nor bu'i kha nas spyi gtsug gi dbu rgyan du 'khor ba'i phyir cod pan yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // bde ba chen po'i mtshan nyid du gnas pas bdag gi bag chags kyi dri ma thams cad dag par gyur pa nyid dang / bde ba chen po de nyid rdo rje nor bu'i kha nas spyi gtsug gi dbu rgyan du 'khor ba'i phyir cod pan yin la /
translated: Since it abides as the characteristic of great bliss, all taints of one's traces are purified. Since that great bliss circulates from the vajra jewel to the crown of the head, it is a crown.

original: de nyid dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ngo bo rdo rje sems dpa' yin la /
analyzed: de nyid dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ngo bo rdo rje sems dpa' yin la /
translated: That is Vajrasattva, the essence of all tathāgatas of the three times.

original: de bdag rang gi dpral ba'i rgyan du rgyas btab pa ni /🔽rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rgyan du thogs //
analyzed: de bdag rang gi dpral ba'i rgyan du rgyas btab pa ni / rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rgyan du thogs //
translated: Since that is the seal on one's forehead ornament,

original: zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: it is said, “The perfect buddha is worn as an ornament.”

original: sdug bsngal gsum gyi sdug bsngal zhi //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum gyi sdug bsngal zhi //
translated: Since the suffering of the three sufferings is purified,🔽it is said, “The suffering of the three sufferings is purified.”

original: zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po dbu rgyan byas pa la dga' ba dang mchog gi dga' ba dang bral ba'i dga' ba gsum ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po dbu rgyan byas pa la dga' ba dang mchog gi dga' ba dang bral ba'i dga' ba gsum ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yin la /
translated: Thus, the three joys of the great vajra holder who is crowned with the great vajra holder, namely, joy, supreme joy, and the joy of separation, are suffering because they are conceptual.

original: de dag rab tu zhi ba gang yin pa de ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba zhes bya bar dgongs te de nyid nges par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de dag rab tu zhi ba gang yin pa de ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba zhes bya bar dgongs te de nyid nges par bstan pa ni /

original: gsum sel ba mtha' yas grol gsum thob //
analyzed: gsum sel ba mtha' yas grol gsum thob //
translated: The three joys are eliminated, and the three of infinite, liberation, and attainment are obtained.

original: ces gsungs la dga' ba dang mchog gi dga' ba dang bral ba'i dga' ba gsum bsal ba las /
analyzed: ces gsungs la dga' ba dang mchog gi dga' ba dang bral ba'i dga' ba gsum bsal ba las /

original: bde ba chen po mtha' yas spros pa dang bral bar gyur cing /
analyzed: bde ba chen po mtha' yas spros pa dang bral bar gyur cing /

analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten sdug bsngal las thar pa ni grol zhes bya ba nyid do //

analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu las grol zhing lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba chen po thob po zhes bya ba nyid do //

translated: Just that is the definite liberation from all the obscurations of karma, afflictions, objects of knowledge, and birth, so it is called definite liberation from all obscurations.
