translated: It is the five syllables of great emptiness,

original: thig le stong pa yi ge brgya //🔽zhes bya ste /
analyzed: thig le stong pa yi ge brgya //🔽zhes bya ste /
translated: the one hundred syllables of the empty drop.

original: thig le ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ba yin la /
analyzed: thig le ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ba yin la /
translated: The drop is like space.

original: nam mkha' ltar stong pa zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar stong pa zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: It is considered to be empty like space.

original: rnam pa kun ldan rnam pa med //
analyzed: rnam pa kun ldan rnam pa med //
translated: Having all aspects, yet without aspects.

original: ces bya ba la de rnam pa kun zhes pa ni rigs lnga dang rigs brgya'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba la de rnam pa kun zhes pa ni rigs lnga dang rigs brgya'i bar du yin no //
translated: Here, all aspects refers to the five families up to the one hundred families.

original: rnam pa ni stong pa zhes bya ba nyid de sngar gyi nges par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ni stong pa zhes bya ba nyid de sngar gyi nges par bshad pa'o //
translated: The aspect is just emptiness, as previously explained.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa dang bcas zhing rnam pa med pa dag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i bdag nyid gang las thob ce na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa dang bcas zhing rnam pa med pa dag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i bdag nyid gang las thob ce na /
translated: From what does one obtain such an aspect, having all aspects and without aspects, and the perfection of the benefit of others?

original: bcu drug phyed phyed thig le can //
analyzed: bcu drug phyed phyed thig le can //
translated: The one possessing the sixteen parts and half a drop.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, it is taught.

original: de nyid dbang rnams kyi mchog tu gyur pa bzhi pa nges par bstan pa nyid la /
analyzed: de nyid dbang rnams kyi mchog tu gyur pa bzhi pa nges par bstan pa nyid la /
translated: Just that is taught to be the supreme of the empowerments, the fourth.

original: de la bcu drug gi phyed ni brgyad yin la /
analyzed: de la bcu drug gi phyed ni brgyad yin la /
translated: There, half of sixteen is eight.

original: brgyad kyi phyed ni bzhi yin /
analyzed: brgyad kyi phyed ni bzhi yin /
translated: Half of eight is four.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba chen po'i ye shes de nyid dga' ba bzhi'i bdag nyid can zhes bya bar dgongs shing /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba chen po'i ye shes de nyid dga' ba bzhi'i bdag nyid can zhes bya bar dgongs shing /
translated: That very exalted wisdom of the simultaneously born great bliss is considered to have the nature of the four joys.

original: skabs 'dir thig le'i sgras ni gnyis rnam par spangs pa zhes brjod la /
analyzed: skabs 'dir thig le'i sgras ni gnyis rnam par spangs pa zhes brjod la /
translated: In this context, the term “drop” is said to be “free from the two.”

original: gnyis ni char byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyis ni char byed pa yin te /
translated: The two are the two extremes,

original: gzung ba dang ; 'dzin pa dang / thabs dang shes rab la sogs pa gnyis su 'dzin pa mtha' dag spangs pa bde ba chen po zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gzung ba dang ; 'dzin pa dang / thabs dang shes rab la sogs pa gnyis su 'dzin pa mtha' dag spangs pa bde ba chen po zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: and it is considered to be the great bliss that is free from all dualistic apprehension, such as apprehending the object and apprehending the subject, method and wisdom, and so on.

original: de nyid rang gi ngo bo bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid rang gi ngo bo bstan pa ni /
translated: The nature of that is taught:

original: yan lag med pa'i rtsis las 'das //🔽zhes gsungs te /🔽de la yan lag gi dngos po'i rnam @270a * //
analyzed: yan lag med pa'i rtsis las 'das // zhes gsungs te / de la yan lag gi dngos po'i rnam @270a * //
translated: It is free from parts and beyond measure.

original: par rtog pa dang / mtshan ma'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad yid la med par gyur cing ngag gis brjod pa'i tshad las 'das pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //🔽bsam gtan bzhi yi rtse mo can //
analyzed: par rtog pa dang / mtshan ma'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad yid la med par gyur cing ngag gis brjod pa'i tshad las 'das pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o // bsam gtan bzhi yi rtse mo can //
translated: In that, all conceptual thoughts of things that have parts and all conceptual thoughts of signs are absent in the mind, and it is beyond the measure of verbal expression.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is the peak of the four meditative concentrations.

original: dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / dga' bral gyi dga' ba rnams kyi bla mar gyur cing gong na med pa ni rtse gcig pa'i bsam gtan yin la /🔽brjod pa dang bral ba kun gyi mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / dga' bral gyi dga' ba rnams kyi bla mar gyur cing gong na med pa ni rtse gcig pa'i bsam gtan yin la / brjod pa dang bral ba kun gyi mtshan nyid dam /
translated: The supreme of the four joys—joy, supreme joy, coemergent joy, and the joy of separation from joy—is one-pointed concentration.

original: kun gyi rnam pa spangs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya zhing /🔽de la yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas byang chub kyi lam chen po'i rim pa'am /
analyzed: kun gyi rnam pa spangs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya zhing / de la yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas byang chub kyi lam chen po'i rim pa'am /
translated: It is free from expression and is said to be the characteristic or aspect of everything.🔽It is the essence that subsumes all things, like a great vessel that contains all the infinite branches of method, such as the sky vajra, and so on, of the stages of the path of perfect complete buddhahood.

original: nam mkha'i rdo rje la sogs pa'i thabs kyi yan lag dpag tu med pa thams cad 'bras chen snod du sdud pa ltar dngos po kun bsdus pa'i ngo bo yin pa dang / de shes pa las dngos po mtha' dag shes par gyur pa nyid dang /
analyzed: nam mkha'i rdo rje la sogs pa'i thabs kyi yan lag dpag tu med pa thams cad 'bras chen snod du sdud pa ltar dngos po kun bsdus pa'i ngo bo yin pa dang / de shes pa las dngos po mtha' dag shes par gyur pa nyid dang /
translated: From knowing that, one knows all things.

original: de nyid la mnyam par brtan pa'i tshul gyis mnyam par gzhag na bdag nyid kyi phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa rnam par dbye ba rigs kyi mtshan nyid dang / sems kyi rang bzhin phyin ci ma log par rig par gyur pa gang yin pa de la /
analyzed: de nyid la mnyam par brtan pa'i tshul gyis mnyam par gzhag na bdag nyid kyi phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa rnam par dbye ba rigs kyi mtshan nyid dang / sems kyi rang bzhin phyin ci ma log par rig par gyur pa gang yin pa de la /
translated: If one is equipoised in that very [great bliss] by the method of stability, then one will know the divisions of one's own aggregates, elements, sense spheres, and so on, the characteristics of the families, and the unmistaken nature of the mind.

original: bsam gtan yan lag kun shes shing //
analyzed: bsam gtan yan lag kun shes shing //
translated: That is what is called knowing all the branches of concentration,

original: ting 'dzin rig dang rgyud rig pa //🔽zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: ting 'dzin rig dang rgyud rig pa // zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: knowing samādhi, and knowing the tantra.

original: de lta bu'i bde ba chen po yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid las 'bras bu sku gsum phun sum tshogs par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de lta bu'i bde ba chen po yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid las 'bras bu sku gsum phun sum tshogs par bstan pa ni /
translated: The perfection of the three bodies as the result from that great bliss that is perfected is taught:

original: ting 'dzin lus can lus kyi mchog / ces pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ting 'dzin lus can lus kyi mchog / ces pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The body of samādhi, the supreme body.

original: de la chos kyi sku ni mtshan ma'i spros pa thams cad dang bral zhing bde ba chen po ni rtse gcig pa'i tshul gyi ting nge 'dzin yin la /
analyzed: de la chos kyi sku ni mtshan ma'i spros pa thams cad dang bral zhing bde ba chen po ni rtse gcig pa'i tshul gyi ting nge 'dzin yin la /
translated: The dharmakāya is free from all proliferation of signs and is the samādhi of great bliss in the manner of being one-pointed.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya zhing /
translated: The one who is supreme among all the bodies of the tathagatas is called that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni sa bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rgyal por gyur pas na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni sa bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rgyal por gyur pas na /
translated: The sambhogakaya of all the tathagatas is the king of the bodhisattvas on the tenth bhumi,

original: longs spyod rdzogs sku kun gyi rgyal //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs sku kun gyi rgyal //
translated: so it is called “the king of all the sambhogakayas.”

original: zhes bya ste de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sprul pa'i sku ni khams gsum gyi 'gro ba'i sems can thams cad kyi don phun sum tshogs par mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ste de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sprul pa'i sku ni khams gsum gyi 'gro ba'i sems can thams cad kyi don phun sum tshogs par mdzad pa ni /
translated: The nirmanakaya of all the tathagatas is the one who accomplishes the perfect benefit of all the beings of the three realms.

original: gdul bya'i zhing rgya chen po la mdzad @270b pa rgya chen por mdzad pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: gdul bya'i zhing rgya chen po la mdzad @270b pa rgya chen por mdzad pa'i phyir na /
translated: Since it is the one who performs the great deeds in the great field of those to be tamed,

original: sprul pa'i sku ste sku yi mchog / ces bya ba nyid do //🔽de ltar lhan cig skyes pa bde ba chen po'i ye shes de lta bu sku gsum gyi bdag nyid du gnas shing /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku ste sku yi mchog / ces bya ba nyid do // de ltar lhan cig skyes pa bde ba chen po'i ye shes de lta bu sku gsum gyi bdag nyid du gnas shing /
translated: it is the nirmanakaya, the supreme body.

original: sprul pa dpag tu med pa 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa ni /
analyzed: sprul pa dpag tu med pa 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa ni /
translated: Thus, the connate gnosis of great bliss abides as the nature of the three kayas and is the cause for the arising of the limitless emanations.

original: sangs rgyas sprul pa'i rgyud 'chang ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sprul pa'i rgyud 'chang ba //
translated: The Buddha holds the causal continuum of emanation.

original: zhes bya zhing khams gsum gyi sems can thams cad bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin gyi spros pa mdzad cing zhi ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis 'gro ba rnams kyi don ji lta ba bzhin du mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya zhing khams gsum gyi sems can thams cad bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin gyi spros pa mdzad cing zhi ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis 'gro ba rnams kyi don ji lta ba bzhin du mdzad pa ni /
translated: Thus, he emanates all sentient beings of the three realms in the nature of great bliss, and he acts for the welfare of beings in the manner of peace and so forth.

original: phyogs bcur sprul pa sna tshogs 'gyed //🔽ji bzhin 'gro ba'i don byed pa //
analyzed: phyogs bcur sprul pa sna tshogs 'gyed // ji bzhin 'gro ba'i don byed pa //
translated: He emanates various emanations in the ten directions.

original: zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: He acts for the welfare of beings just as they are.

original: lha yi dbang po lha yi lha //
analyzed: lha yi dbang po lha yi lha //
translated: He is the lord of gods, the god of gods.

original: zhes pa ni de la lha ni bde byed la sogs pa yin la de'i lha ni lha'i dbang po brgya byin yin te /🔽de'i lha ni dbang phyug chen po yin la /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de la lha ni bde byed la sogs pa yin la de'i lha ni lha'i dbang po brgya byin yin te / de'i lha ni dbang phyug chen po yin la /
translated: Here, gods are Brahma and so forth, and the god of those is Indra, the lord of the gods.

original: dbang phyug chen po'i lha ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid do //
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po'i lha ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid do //
translated: The god of that is Mahesvara, and the god of Mahesvara is the Tathagata himself.

original: de ltar bde ba chen po 'dis kyang 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub phun sum tshogs pa ster bar byed pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub de bzhin gshegs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa ster bar byed ces bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de ltar bde ba chen po 'dis kyang 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub phun sum tshogs pa ster bar byed pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub de bzhin gshegs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa ster bar byed ces bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Thus, it is considered that this great bliss bestows the perfect mundane attainments and bestows the perfect supramundane attainment of the tathagatas.🔽The lord who bestows such perfect attainments is called the asura.

original: de lta bu'i dngos grub phun sum tshogs pa ster bar byed pa'i bdag por gyur pa dang / lha ma yin gyi sgras ni mi skyo ba zhes bya la /
analyzed: de lta bu'i dngos grub phun sum tshogs pa ster bar byed pa'i bdag por gyur pa dang / lha ma yin gyi sgras ni mi skyo ba zhes bya la /
translated: As for asura, it means “not discouraged.”🔽Discouragement is when the mind is turned away from its own nature by external nonhuman spirits and so on, causing it to change into another aspect.

original: de la skyo ba ni sems rang gi ngo bo las phyi rol gyi mi ma yin pa la sogs pas sems bsgyur te rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba byed pa ltar tha mal pa'i gnas skabs sems rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa nyid du phyin ci log
analyzed: de la skyo ba ni sems rang gi ngo bo las phyi rol gyi mi ma yin pa la sogs pas sems bsgyur te rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba byed pa ltar tha mal pa'i gnas skabs sems rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa nyid du phyin ci log
translated: In the ordinary state, the naturally pure mind is🔽turned away by the power of mistaken clinging into the concepts of subject and object.

original: gi mngon par zhen pa'i stobs kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag 'gog par gyur pa'i bdag por gyur pa gang yin pa de la /
analyzed: gi mngon par zhen pa'i stobs kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag 'gog par gyur pa'i bdag por gyur pa gang yin pa de la /
translated: The lord who causes the cessation of those is called the asura.

original: lha yi dbang po lha min bdag / ces pa nyid de //
analyzed: lha yi dbang po lha min bdag / ces pa nyid de //
translated: The lord of the gods, the lord of the demigods,

original: 'chi med dbang po lha yi bla //
analyzed: 'chi med dbang po lha yi bla //
translated: The lord of immortality, the lord of the gods,

original: zhes pa ni bde ba chen po'i spros pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa'i rkyen las byung ba 'chi 'gog ltar byed pa dang / mi 'chi ba la dbang ba ster bar byed pa bla mar gyur pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya zhing /
analyzed: zhes pa ni bde ba chen po'i spros pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa'i rkyen las byung ba 'chi 'gog ltar byed pa dang / mi 'chi ba la dbang ba ster bar byed pa bla mar gyur pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya zhing /
translated: The one who is called that is the one who, by the characteristic of being free from the elaborations of great bliss, acts like the cessation of death, and bestows immortality, and is the guru.

original: de'i stobs kyis bdud dang dbang phyug la sogs ba rab tu 'joms shing nyon mongs pa mtha' dag 'joms par mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis bdud dang dbang phyug la sogs ba rab tu 'joms shing nyon mongs pa mtha' dag 'joms par mdzad pa ni /
translated: By his power, he is the one who completely conquers Mara, Mahesvara, and so forth, and who acts to destroy all afflictions.

original: 'joms byed 'joms byed dbang phyug po //
analyzed: 'joms byed 'joms byed dbang phyug po //
translated: He is the conqueror of the conqueror, the lord.

original: zhes bya la de nyid kyi srid pa'i 'joms pa chen po rab tu rgal bar gyur pa ni //🔽srid pa'i dgon pa las brgal ba //
analyzed: zhes bya la de nyid kyi srid pa'i 'joms pa chen po rab tu rgal bar gyur pa ni // srid pa'i dgon pa las brgal ba //
translated: By him, the great crossing of the wilderness of existence is accomplished.

original: zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: He is the one who has crossed the wilderness of existence.

original: de ltar @271a * //
analyzed: de ltar @271a * //
translated: Thus,

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i zhi ba gang yin pa de la bdag nyid gcig pu'i bla ma zhes bya ba phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa ster bar byed ba'i bla mar gyur ba gang yin ba de la /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i zhi ba gang yin pa de la bdag nyid gcig pu'i bla ma zhes bya ba phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa ster bar byed ba'i bla mar gyur ba gang yin ba de la /
translated: That innate peace is the guru of one's own self alone, the guru who bestows the abundant qualities of all tathagatas of the ten directions.🔽To that guru,

original: ston pa gcig bu 'gro ba'i bla //
analyzed: ston pa gcig bu 'gro ba'i bla //
translated: the sole teacher, the guru of beings,🔽that very guru who is present in the great trichiliocosm as great wisdom and who bestows all the qualities of a buddha, such as the strengths and fearlessnesses,🔽to that guru,

original: zhes bya ba la de nyid stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du ye shes chen por rab tu gnas par gyur pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs ba thams cad ster bar byed pa'i phyir bdag bor gyur pa de la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la de nyid stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du ye shes chen por rab tu gnas par gyur pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs ba thams cad ster bar byed pa'i phyir bdag bor gyur pa de la /
translated: the great lord of the Dharma,

original: 'jig rten phyogs bcur rab grags pa //
analyzed: 'jig rten phyogs bcur rab grags pa //
translated: the one renowned in the ten directions of the world,

original: chos kyi sbyin bdag che ba po //
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin bdag che ba po //
translated: the one who is the great lord of the Dharma,

original: zhes bya'o // bde ba chen po bzhi pa 'di nyid dpa' bo go cha dang ldan pas rab tu mi zad pa'i mtshon thogs te /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // bde ba chen po bzhi pa 'di nyid dpa' bo go cha dang ldan pas rab tu mi zad pa'i mtshon thogs te /
translated: this very fourth stage of great bliss is the one who, as a hero with armor, takes up the weapon of imperishability.

original: pha rol gyi dpung thams cad 'dul bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: pha rol gyi dpung thams cad 'dul bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching on subduing all the armies of the opponent

original: byams pa'i go cha chas pa ste //
analyzed: byams pa'i go cha chas pa ste //
translated: is the armor of love.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: As it is said,

original: khams gsum gyi sems can thams cad la rab tu phan par 'dod pa bdag nyid du gnas pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya zhing sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal la nye bar dmigs ba la mandala gyi tshul du bgos bas thams cad shes
analyzed: khams gsum gyi sems can thams cad la rab tu phan par 'dod pa bdag nyid du gnas pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya zhing sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal la nye bar dmigs ba la mandala gyi tshul du bgos bas thams cad shes
translated: The one who abides as the very one who wishes to benefit all sentient beings of the three realms is so called.  By observing the suffering of all sentient beings, he is clad in the manner of a mandala.

original: rab ral gri dang mda' gzhu'i tshul thogs te /
analyzed: rab ral gri dang mda' gzhu'i tshul thogs te /
translated: He takes up the sword and bow and arrow of wisdom.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i tshogs ni rnam par g-yeng ba'i tshul gyi g-yul ngo yin la rab tu sel bar mdzad pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i tshogs ni rnam par g-yeng ba'i tshul gyi g-yul ngo yin la rab tu sel bar mdzad pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The army of afflictions such as attachment is the battle in the manner of distraction.  The one who completely eliminates that is

original: snying rje yi ni ya lad bgos //
analyzed: snying rje yi ni ya lad bgos //
translated: clad in the armor of compassion.

original: shes rab ral gri mda' gzhu thogs //
analyzed: shes rab ral gri mda' gzhu thogs //
translated: Taking up the sword and bow and arrow of wisdom,

original: nyon mongs mi shes g-yul ngo sel //
analyzed: nyon mongs mi shes g-yul ngo sel //
translated: he eliminates the battle of the afflictions and ignorance.

original: zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: This is so.

original: de lta bu'i bde ba chen po de nyid gzhom pa'i rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag rtog pa med par 'joms pa por gyur cing /
analyzed: de lta bu'i bde ba chen po de nyid gzhom pa'i rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag rtog pa med par 'joms pa por gyur cing /
translated: Such great bliss itself is the destroyer of all conceptual thoughts, for it destroys them without conceptualization.

original: bdag la gnod par byed pa'i bdud kyi dgra thams cad thul bar gyur pa dang / da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus su bdud bzhi'i 'jigs pa sel bar byed pa dang / bdud kyi dpung thams cad pham par byed pas na /
analyzed: bdag la gnod par byed pa'i bdud kyi dgra thams cad thul bar gyur pa dang / da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus su bdud bzhi'i 'jigs pa sel bar byed pa dang / bdud kyi dpung thams cad pham par byed pas na /
translated: It is the one who has subdued all the enemies of Mara who harm oneself, and it is the one who removes the fear of the four Maras in the present and future, and it is the one who defeats all the armies of Mara.

original: dpa' bo bdud dgra bdud 'dul ba //
analyzed: dpa' bo bdud dgra bdud 'dul ba //
translated: Therefore, it is the hero, the enemy of Mara, the one who tames Mara,

original: bdud bzhi'i 'jigs pa sel bar byed //
analyzed: bdud bzhi'i 'jigs pa sel bar byed //
translated: the one who removes the fear of the four Maras,

original: bdud kyi dpung rnams pham byed pa //
analyzed: bdud kyi dpung rnams pham byed pa //
translated: the one who defeats the armies of Mara.

original: zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyid do //
